name: console
trans: 安慰，抚慰；控制台，仪表板

sentences.english: No one could console her when Peter died.
sentences.chinese: 彼得去世时没人能够安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed
a flat board that contains the controls for a machine, piece of electrical equipment, computer etc

name: consist
trans: 组成，构成；在于，存在于；一致，符合

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

name: consistent
trans: 前后一致的，始终如一的；相符的，不矛盾的

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

name: constant
trans: 坚定的，永恒的，忠实的

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: constituent
trans: 构成的，组成的

sentences.english: the EU and its constituent members
sentences.chinese: 欧盟及其成员国

sentences.english: He told his constituents that he would continue to represent them to the best of his ability.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他的选民们他会继续竭尽所能代表他们。

detailed_translations.english: being one of the parts of something
someone who votes in a particular area

name: constitute
trans: 组成，构成；建立，制定（法律史）

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

name: constitution
trans: 构成，构造；体格，体质；宪法，法规，章程

sentences.english: The right to speak freely is written into the Constitution of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由的权利被写入美国宪法。

sentences.english: She’s got a strong constitution – she’ll recover in no time.
sentences.chinese: 她体质强壮，很快就会恢复。

sentences.english: What’s the chemical constitution of the dye?
sentences.chinese: 这种染料的化学成分是什么？

detailed_translations.english: a set of basic laws and principles that a country or organization is governed by

name: constrain
trans: 强制，迫使；限制，限定，约束

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: construct
trans: 建造，构造；创立，构思；建造物；构想

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: distinct
trans: 有区别的，不同的，不同种类的；明显的，清楚的；确切的，确实的

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

name: distinction
trans: 差别，杰出，不同凡响

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: distinguish
trans: 区别，辨别；使有特色，使有别于；使杰出，使出众

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

name: fruitful
trans: 多产的，果实累累的；富有成效的

sentences.english: Today’s meeting proved more fruitful than last week’s.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明今天的会议比上星期的更有成效。

sentences.english: a busy and fruitful time
sentences.chinese: 忙碌而有成效的一段时间

sentences.english: a fruitful source of information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息来源

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有成效的；多产的；果实结得多的
detailed_translations.english: producing good results

name: frustrate
trans: 挫败，阻挠，使灰心；使无效

sentences.english: Their attempts to speak to him were frustrated by the guards.
sentences.chinese: 他们想跟他说话，但被警卫拦住了。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone’s plans, efforts, or attempts from succeeding

name: fulfill
trans: 履行，实现，完成；使满意，起...作用

sentences.english: And that is why we can fulfill our destiny.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我们能实现我们的命运。

sentences.english: What important dream have you yet to realize and fulfill?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么重要的梦想还没有实现和完成？

name: function
trans: 功能，作用；职务，职责；正式的典礼，宴会

sentences.english: Her legs have now ceased to function .
sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

name: fund
trans: 资金，基金；储备，蕴藏；为...提供资金，资助

sentences.english: The fund was set up to try to save the cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 设立基金以挽救大教堂。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is collected and kept for a particular purpose
to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc

name: fundamental
trans: 基础的，基本的；根本的，主要的，十分重大的，基本原则

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: evidence
trans: 形迹，迹象；根据，证据

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: evident
trans: 明显的，明白的

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: evil
trans: 邪恶的，罪恶的；邪恶，罪恶

sentences.english: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的种种祸害

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful
someone who is evil deliberately does very cruel things to harm other people

name: environment
trans: 环境，外界，客观环境；自然环境，生态环境

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: enterprise
trans: 事业心，进取心；事业，规划；企业单位

sentences.english: state/public enterprise (=one owned by the government)
sentences.chinese: 国有企业/公共事业单位

sentences.english: We’re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 事业,企(事)业单位；事业心,进取心
detailed_translations.english: a company, organization, or business

name: entertain
trans: 招待，款待；使...娱乐，使有兴趣

sentences.english: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

sentences.english: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
sentences.chinese: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。

sentences.english: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
sentences.chinese: 你招待客户有补助吗？

detailed_translations.english: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

name: entertainment
trans: 招待，款待，娱乐；文娱节目，娱乐性表演

sentences.english: The town provides a wide choice of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 该镇提供各式各样的娱乐活动。

sentences.english: There will be live entertainment (= performed then, not recorded ) throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 现场表演将持续一整天。

sentences.english: The dolphins give good entertainment value (= a lot of amusement and interest ).
sentences.chinese: 海豚具有很高的娱乐价值。

detailed_translations.chinese: 娱乐， 文娱节目， 表演会； 招待， 款待， 请客
detailed_translations.english: things such as films, television, performances etc that are intended to amuse or interest people

name: monopoly
trans: 垄断，专卖；独占，专利品

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

name: monotonous
trans: 单调无聊的，毫无变化的

sentences.english: a monotonous diet
sentences.chinese: 单调的饮食

sentences.english: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
sentences.chinese: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

detailed_translations.english: boring because of always being the same

name: mood
trans: 心境，情绪，心情；氛围，气氛

sentences.english: You’re in a good mood this morning!
sentences.chinese: 你今天早晨心情不错啊！

sentences.english: the general mood of depression in the office
sentences.chinese: 办公室里普遍的沮丧情绪

detailed_translations.english: the way you feel at a particular time

name: transmission
trans: 播送，发射，传送，传染，传播

sentences.english: worldwide data transmission
sentences.chinese: 全球数据传输

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending out electronic signals, messages etc, using radio, television, or other similar equipment

name: transmit
trans: 传送，传递；播送，发射；传染，传播

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

name: transplant
trans: 移植，移居；移植的器官，移植物

sentences.english: The operation to transplant a kidney is now fairly routine.
sentences.chinese: 移植肾脏的手术如今相当常见。

detailed_translations.english: to move an organ, piece of skin etc from one person’s body and put it into another as a form of medical treatment

detailed_translations.chinese: 移植；移植器官；被移植物；移居者
detailed_translations.english: the operation of transplanting an organ, piece of skin etc

name: transport
trans: 运送，运输，搬动；运输系统，运送工具

sentences.english: trucks used for transporting oil
sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

name: stock
trans: 原料，备料；库存，存货；资本，股票，公债；储备，储存，供应

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

name: store
trans: 商店，店铺；贮藏，贮藏所；存储，记忆

sentences.english: At Christmas the stores stay open late.
sentences.chinese: 在圣诞节期间，商店营业到很晚。

sentences.english: a store of wood
sentences.chinese: 木料储备

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.

name: storage
trans: 储存，储藏，保管；库房

sentences.english: the storage of highly radioactive material
sentences.chinese: 高放射性材料的存放

sentences.english: storage costs
sentences.chinese: 保管费用

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used

name: stride
trans: 阔步前进，大踏步走；进展，发展，进步

sentences.english: He strode toward her.
sentences.chinese: 他大步向她走去。

sentences.english: Paco reached the door in only three strides.
sentences.chinese: 帕科三大步就走到了门口。

detailed_translations.english: to walk quickly with long steps
a long step you make while you are walking

name: strike
trans: 打击，突然袭击，罢工，偶然发现

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

name: striking
trans: 显著的，突出的；妩媚动人的，标致的

sentences.english: a striking contrast between wealth and poverty
sentences.chinese: 显著的贫富差异

sentences.english: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides.
sentences.chinese: 那些统计数据最显著的特征是高自杀率。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

name: string
trans: 细绳，一连串，串起

sentences.english: Her key hung on a string around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的钥匙穿了根绳子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: a ball of string
sentences.chinese: 一团细绳

sentences.english: I need a piece of string to tie this package.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一根绳子来捆这个包裹。

sentences.english: a string of pearls
sentences.chinese: 一串珍珠

detailed_translations.english: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

name: structure
trans: 结构体，（尤指）建筑物；结构，构造；精心组织，周密安排，体系

sentences.english: challenges to the existing power structure
sentences.chinese: 对现有权力结构的挑战

sentences.english: A new management structure has been introduced.
sentences.chinese: 已推行一种新的管理结构。

sentences.english: molecular structures
sentences.chinese: 分子结构

detailed_translations.english: the way in which the parts of something are connected with each other and form a whole, or the thing that these parts make up

name: stun
trans: 使震惊，使晕倒；给（某人）以深刻印象，使深深感动

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: primary
trans: 初级的，初等的，小学的；最初的，最早的；首要的，主要的，基本的

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: prime
trans: 最初的，第一的，原始的；首要的，主要的，基本的；最好的，第一流的，上乘的

sentences.english: Smoking is the prime cause of lung disease.
sentences.chinese: 抽烟是引发肺部疾病的首要原因。

sentences.english: Our prime concern is providing jobs for all young school leavers.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是为所有的年轻毕业生提供工作。

sentences.english: He was named as the prime suspect in the murder investigation.
sentences.chinese: 在那宗谋杀案的调查中他被定为主要嫌疑人。

sentences.english: Good management is of prime importance in business.
sentences.chinese: 良好的经营管理在商业领域尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: most important
the time in your life when you are strongest and most active
to prepare someone for a situation so that they know what to do

name: primitive
trans: 原始的，上古的，早期的；简单的，落后的，粗糙的；原始本能的

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: a primitive nomadic tribe
sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.english: the tools used by primitive man
sentences.chinese: 原始人所用的工具

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
sentences.chinese: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 原始的；简单的；简单的，简陋的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

name: principal
trans: 最重要的，主要的；负责人，校长

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: principle
trans: 原理，原则；工作原理，定律；行为准则，规范，信条

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: psychiatry
trans: 精神病学，精神病治疗法

sentences.english: In it, he argued that psychiatry was a branch of medical science and should be investigated by observation and experimentation like the other natural sciences.
sentences.chinese: 在书中，他主张精神病学是医学的一个分支，应当像其他自然科学一样以观察和实验为研究手段。

detailed_translations.english: the study and treatment of mental illnesses

name: psychology
trans: 心理学，心理，心理特征

sentences.english: I understood the psychology of this, but it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这种心理，但这仍然让我感到伤心。

sentences.english: It was not until the mid-twentieth century that psychology really came into its own.
sentences.chinese: 直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。

sentences.english: His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

name: liability
trans: 责任，义务；债务；倾向

sentences.english: Tenants have legal liability for any damage they cause.
sentences.chinese: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

sentences.english: The company had assets of $138 million and liabilities of $120.5 million.
sentences.chinese: 该公司有1.38亿美元资产和1.205亿美元的负债。

detailed_translations.english: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

name: liable
trans: 负有法律责任的，有义务的；会...的；有...倾向的；有...危险的，可能遭受...的

sentences.english: The car is liable to overheat on long trips.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车跑长途容易过热。

detailed_translations.english: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc

name: liberal
trans: 不严格的，不精确的；（政治或经济上）自由的，支持（社会，政治）变革的；慷慨的，大方的

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

name: liberate
trans: 解放，释放，使自由

sentences.english: A few days later, our armies liberated the city.
sentences.chinese: 几天以后，我军解放了这座城市。

detailed_translations.english: to free prisoners, a city, a country etc from someone’s control

name: license
trans: 许可证，执照；随便，肆意行动

sentences.english: No special license will be regranted to anyone from now on.
sentences.chinese: 特殊许可证今后不得向任何人再行发放。

sentences.english: Remind me to renew the driver's license.It will lapse next month.
sentences.chinese: 提醒我更换驾驶执照，它下个月就失效了。

sentences.english: The next time the client connects to the server, it will obtain another license.
sentences.chinese: 在客户端下一次连接到服务器时，它将获得另一个许可证。

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

name: innocent
trans: 清白的，无罪的；无害的，无辜受害的，成为牺牲品的；天真的，单纯的

sentences.english: Nobody would believe that I was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 没人肯相信我是清白的。

sentences.english: The court found him innocent and he was released.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判他无罪，他被释放了。

sentences.english: She had always regarded Greg as a hopeless innocent where women were concerned.
sentences.chinese: 她过去一直认为格雷格在关于女人方面是一个不可救药的无知者。

detailed_translations.english: not guilty of a crime
An innocent is someone who is innocent

name: innovation
trans: 革新，改革，创新；新方法，新技术，新思想

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: anguish
trans: 极度痛苦，苦恼；使痛苦，苦恼，悲痛；感到苦恼或悲痛

sentences.english: And we know of your anguish.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解你们的痛苦。

sentences.english: She suffered the anguish of despair.
sentences.chinese: 她忍受着绝望的痛苦。

sentences.english: And in their anguish, they both forgot the nearness of my bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 极度的痛苦让他们忘记我的卧室就在附近。

detailed_translations.english: mental or physical suffering caused by extreme pain or worry

name: annoy
trans: 使恼怒，使生气；打搅，骚扰

sentences.english: He is not doing this to annoy you.
sentences.chinese: 他做这件事并非是要惹你烦恼。

sentences.english: I am convinced that some people complain just to annoy me, for something to do, or they simply enjoy complaining.
sentences.chinese: 我以为身边的人抱怨是为了令我烦恼、是为了解决某些事、又或者他们就是喜欢抱怨。

name: annual
trans: 每年的，年度的，一年一次的；年报，年刊，年鉴

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

name: anchor
trans: 锚；精神支柱，靠山，给人以安全感的人或物

sentences.english: We dropped anchor a few yards offshore.
sentences.chinese: 我们在离岸几码远的地方抛锚停航。

sentences.english: The next morning, they weighed anchor (=  lifted the anchor  ) and began to move south again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上他们起锚，又开始向南航行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 锚；抛锚停泊；靠山；新闻节目主播
detailed_translations.english: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving
to fasten something firmly so that it cannot move

name: confine
trans: 囚禁，限制，使局限

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: confirm
trans: 加强，巩固；证实，肯定；批准，确认

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: conflict
trans: （尤指长期的）战争，战斗；冲突，抵触

sentences.english: the threat of industrial conflict in the coalfields
sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

name: confidence
trans: 信任，信心；私下里说的话

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: confident
trans: 确信的，自信的

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: confidential
trans: 秘密的，机密的；亲信的

sentences.english: a confidential government report
sentences.chinese: 一份机密的政府报告

sentences.english: Doctors are required to keep patients’ records completely confidential .
sentences.chinese: 医生必须对病人的病历完全保密。

sentences.english: The information will be regarded as strictly confidential (= completely confidential ) .
sentences.chinese: 这一信息将被视为绝对机密。

detailed_translations.english: spoken or written in secret and intended to be kept secret

name: configuration
trans: 布局，结构，构造，格局，形状；计算机的配置

sentences.english: ...Stonehenge, in southwestern England, an ancient configuration of giant stones.
sentences.chinese: …史前巨石柱群，位于英国西南部，是一座古代巨石阵列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 配置， 布局， 构造
detailed_translations.english: the shape or arrangement of the parts of something

name: trail
trans: 踪迹，痕迹；追踪，跟踪

sentences.english: The trail led over Boulder Pass before descending to a lake.
sentences.chinese: 小路越过博尔德山口，然后向下通往湖边。

sentences.english: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车开过，留下一股黑烟。

sentences.english: Police trailed the gang for several days.
sentences.chinese: 警察跟踪了那个团伙好几天。

detailed_translations.english: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

name: train
trans: 列车，火车；行列，一串；训练，培养

sentences.english: We went all the way to Inverness by train.
sentences.chinese: 我们一路坐火车到因弗内斯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of several carriages that are connected to each other and pulled along a railway line by an engine
to teach someone the skills of a particular job or activity, or to be taught these skills

name: training
trans: 训练，培养

sentences.english: Police drivers have to undergo intensive training .
sentences.chinese: 警察驾驶员都得接受强化训练。

sentences.english: a rigorous training session
sentences.chinese: 一节严格的训练课

sentences.english: On-the-job training will be supplemented by classroom lectures.
sentences.chinese: 除了在职培训，还将有课堂授课作为补充。

sentences.english: The shop opens late on Fridays because of staff training .
sentences.chinese: 因为员工培训，这家商店周五较晚开门营业。

detailed_translations.english: the process of teaching or being taught the skills for a particular job or activity

name: trait
trans: 特征，特点，特性

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: view
trans: 景象，风景；意见，见解；观察，观看；眼界

sentences.english: an opportunity to view the film before it goes on general release
sentences.chinese: 在影片公映之前观影的机会

detailed_translations.english: to think about something or someone in a particular way

name: viewpoint
trans: 观点

sentences.english: Try and think of it from the child’s viewpoint.
sentences.chinese: 尽量从孩子的角度来考虑这件事。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of thinking about a problem or subject

name: violence
trans: 暴力，暴行；狂热，强烈的感情；激烈，猛烈

sentences.english: There is too much sex and violence on TV these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今电视上性爱和暴力场面太多。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to hurt other people physically

name: violent
trans: 猛烈的，激烈的；强暴的，暴力引起的

sentences.english: the increase in violent crime
sentences.chinese: 暴力犯罪的增多

sentences.english: violent clashes between the police and demonstrators
sentences.chinese: 警方与示威者之间发生的暴力冲突

sentences.english: 31 people have been injured in violent incidents throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 今天一天有31人在暴力事件中受伤。

sentences.english: The riots ended in the violent deaths of three teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 动乱以三名少年的惨死而告终。

detailed_translations.english: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

name: virtual
trans: 实际上的，事实上的

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

name: virtue
trans: 美德，德行；优点，长处

sentences.english: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

sentences.english: Wilkins is now extolling the virtues of organic farming.
sentences.chinese: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

detailed_translations.english: moral goodness of character and behaviour

name: apparent
trans: 显然的，明明白白的；表面上的，貌似（真实）的

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: appeal
trans: 有感染力，有吸引力；诉诸，求助；上诉，申诉

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.english: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.english: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

detailed_translations.english: an urgent request for something important
to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

name: appear
trans: 出现，暴露；出场；问世；来到；好像是，彷佛

sentences.english: Police have found what appear to be human remains.
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了疑似人体遗骸的东西。

sentences.english: He tried to make it appear that she had committed suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制造她自杀的假象。

sentences.english: It may be less useful than it appears at first.
sentences.chinese: 这可能没有一开始显得那么有用。

sentences.english: Two faces appeared at our window.
sentences.chinese: 两张面孔出现在我们的窗口。

sentences.english: The car seemed to appear from nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车好像是突然间从哪里冒出来的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say how something seems, especially from what you know about it or from what you can see

name: appearance
trans: 出现，出场；外表。外观，外貌

sentences.english: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

sentences.english: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。

sentences.english: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。

sentences.english: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
sentences.chinese: 她表面上很镇静，内心却十分担忧。

sentences.english: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。

sentences.english: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
sentences.chinese: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。

sentences.english: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
sentences.chinese: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
sentences.chinese: 你不该以貌取人。

sentences.english: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学校里学习很用功，只是表面上并不显得特别如此。

sentences.english: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
sentences.chinese: 从所有迹象来看，这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。

sentences.english: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 这些学生看上去如天使一般，但外表可能是会骗人的。

sentences.english: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
sentences.chinese: 从各方面看，他都是个体面而成功的商人。

sentences.english: The industry has changed greatly with the appearance of new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 新技术问世后，这一行业出现了天翻地覆的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something looks to other people

name: appliance
trans: 用具，器具

sentences.english: The device most often used to do this is a load balancer, which is an appliance that accepts requests from the outside world and hands them off to the next available application server.
sentences.chinese: 进行这一操作最常用的设备是一个负载均衡器，这是一个从外部接收请求并将它们移交给下一个可用应用程序服务器的装置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a  cooker  or  washing machine  , used in people’s homes

name: applicable
trans: 能应用的，适用的

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: application
trans: 请求，申请；申请书

sentences.english: We receive hundreds of job applications each year.
sentences.chinese: 我们每年收到数百封求职信。

sentences.english: I filled in the application form and sent it off.
sentences.chinese: 我填完申请表后把它寄了出去。

sentences.english: You have to submit your application before the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 月底之前必须递交申请。

sentences.english: I’ve put in an application for a transfer.
sentences.chinese: 我已递交了调动申请。

sentences.english: He received a letter saying that his application had been rejected .
sentences.chinese: 他收到一封信，告知他的申请已被拒绝。

sentences.english: It can take a long time for your visa application to be processed .
sentences.chinese: 办理签证申请可能需要很长时间。

sentences.english: The Council is currently reviewing the way it deals with planning applications .
sentences.chinese: 市政会目前正在审查其处理规划申请的方式。

sentences.english: Thank you for your letter of application , which we received yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 你的申请信昨天收悉，谢谢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 申请， 申请书； 施用， 涂抹； 应用， 实施； 实用性
detailed_translations.english: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something

name: appoint
trans: 任命，委派；约定，指定

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for a position or a job

name: appointment
trans: 约会；预约，约定；任命，委托；职务，职位

sentences.english: All consultations are by appointment only.
sentences.chinese: 就诊必须预约。

sentences.english: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
sentences.chinese: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

name: apply
trans: 涂，敷；应用，使用；申请，请求

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

name: appreciate
trans: 欣赏，赏识，重视；意识到，理解，领会

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: discriminate
trans: 区别，辨别；有区别地对待，歧视

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: discuss
trans: 讨论，商议

sentences.english: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
sentences.chinese: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。

sentences.english: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想进一步讨论此事，请打电话给我。

sentences.english: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something

name: disease
trans: 疾病

sentences.english: His father died of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲死于心脏病。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病， 疾病； 不健全， 弊端
detailed_translations.english: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

name: escape
trans: 逃跑，逃脱；躲避，避免

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: especially
trans: 特别，尤其

sentences.english: I never liked long walks, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 我向来不喜欢长距离散步，尤其在冬天。

sentences.english: Art books are expensive to produce, especially if they contain colour illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 美术类书籍制作成本很高，尤其是那些带彩色插图的。

sentences.english: I was especially fond of chocolate biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我特别爱吃巧克力饼干。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is more important or happens more with one particular thing than with others

name: essay
trans: 文章，短文；企图，试图

sentences.english: an essay on Bernard Shaw
sentences.chinese: 关于萧伯纳的文章

sentences.english: We asked Jason to write an essay about his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 我们让杰森写一篇关于他家乡的短文。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study

name: essence
trans: 本质，实质；要素

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

name: essential
trans: 必要的，必不可少的；本质的，基本的

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

name: establish
trans: 建立，设立；确定，证实；安置，使定居；派任

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: estimate
trans: 估计，估价

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: ethic
trans: 道德体系，道德准则。伦理标准；伦理学，道德学

sentences.english: The old ethic of hard work has given way to a new ethic of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 旧有的崇尚勤勉的道德观已被及时行乐的新观念所取代。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes

name: ethnic
trans: 民族的，种族的；某文化群体的（典型的）

sentences.english: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia
sentences.chinese: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

sentences.english: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines
sentences.chinese: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

name: evaluate
trans: 估价，评价

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: industrial
trans: 工业的，产业的

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

name: industrialize
trans: 使工业化

sentences.english: Energy consumption rises as countries industrialize.
sentences.chinese: 能源消耗随着各国工业化而增加。

detailed_translations.english: When a country industrializes or is industrialized, it develops a lot of industries

name: industry
trans: 工业，产业；勤劳，勤奋

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

name: inevitable
trans: 不可避免的，必然发生的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: miserable
trans: 痛苦的，悲惨的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: misery
trans: 痛苦，悲惨，不幸

sentences.english: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这里所目睹的情景是许许多多的人都生活困苦。

sentences.english: the misery of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 失业的痛苦

sentences.english: the miseries of war
sentences.chinese: 战争造成的苦难

detailed_translations.english: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick

name: mislead
trans: 把...引错方向；误导；使产生错误想法，欺骗

sentences.english: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
sentences.chinese: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

name: mix
trans: 混合，合群；混淆

sentences.english: Oil and water don’t mix.
sentences.chinese: 油和水不相融。

detailed_translations.english: if you mix two or more substances or if they mix, they combine to become a single substance, and they cannot be easily separated

name: mixture
trans: 混合，混合物，混合剂

sentences.english: The town is a mixture of the old and the new.
sentences.chinese: 这个小城新旧结合。

detailed_translations.english: a combination of two or more different things, feelings, or types of people

name: necessary
trans: 必要的，必需的；无法避免的

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

name: necessitate
trans: 使成为必要，需要；迫使

sentences.english: Lack of money necessitated a change of plan.
sentences.chinese: 由于缺乏资金，只能改变计划。

detailed_translations.english: to make it necessary for you to do something

name: necessity
trans: 必要性；必然性；必需品；迫不得已，贫困

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

name: negative
trans: 否定的，消极的；阴性的

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: negotiate
trans: 谈判，交涉，商议

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: outer
trans: 外部的，外面的，外层的

sentences.english: His inner conflict is related to struggles in the outer world.
sentences.chinese: 他内心的矛盾和外部世界的争斗有关。

detailed_translations.english: relating to objects, activities etc that are part of the world, as opposed to your own thoughts and feelings

name: outlet
trans: 出路，出口；发泄途径

sentences.english: a waste water outlet
sentences.chinese: 污水排放口

sentences.english: Is football a good outlet for men’s aggression?
sentences.chinese: 足球是男人宣泄好斗情绪的有效途径吗？

detailed_translations.english: a pipe or hole through which something such as a liquid or gas can flow out

name: outline
trans: 轮廓，外形；大纲，提纲，梗概

sentences.english: a research proposal outline
sentences.chinese: 研究计划梗概

detailed_translations.english: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details

name: outlook
trans: 景色，风光；观点，见解；前景，展望

sentences.english: Exercise will improve your looks and your outlook.
sentences.chinese: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

detailed_translations.english: your general attitude to life and the world

name: output
trans: 产量，输出量

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: poverty
trans: 贫困，贫穷

sentences.english: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.english: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.english: the causes of urban poverty
sentences.chinese: 造成城市贫困的原因

detailed_translations.english: the situation or experience of being poor

name: power
trans: 能力，功率，动力，电力；权力，势力，政权

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: practical
trans: 实际的，实用的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: practice
trans: 练习，实习；实践，实际；业务，开业

sentences.english: religious beliefs and practices
sentences.chinese: 宗教信仰和习俗

sentences.english: dangerous working practices
sentences.chinese: 危险的工作方法

detailed_translations.english: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom

name: practise
trans: 实践，实行，实习，训练；养成...的习惯；从事（医务、法律等工作）

sentences.english: They moved the furniture back to practise their dance routine.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家具往后挪以便练习舞蹈动作。

sentences.english: It gives students the opportunity to practice their speaking skills.
sentences.chinese: 这给学生提供了锻炼口才的机会。

detailed_translations.english: to do an activity, often regularly, in order to improve your skill or to prepare for a test

name: practitioner
trans: 习艺者，实习者；从业者（尤指行医者）

sentences.english: RMC provides structure in three areas for the practitioner: productivity, guidance , and personalization.
sentences.chinese: RMC在三个领域为从业者提供了结构：生产力，指导和个性化。

sentences.english: The dictionary is mainly for civil aviation practitioner, aviation majored students and Aviation enthusiasts.
sentences.chinese: 词典主要面向民航从业人员、航空专业学员以及航空爱好者。

sentences.english: The articulation of work and life, cast as work-life balance, has become a key feature of much current government, practitioner and academic debate.
sentences.chinese: 当今的工作和生活，扮演工作与生活的平衡，已成为一个关键特性当前的很多政府、从业者和学术争论。

name: preach
trans: 讲道，布道；极力劝说，说教；竭力鼓吹，宣传

sentences.english: He traveled the southern states, preaching the gospel .
sentences.chinese: 他游历南方各州宣讲福音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说教；讲道；鼓吹；传道；反复灌输
detailed_translations.english: to talk about a religious subject in a public place, especially in a church during a service

name: precede
trans: 在...之前；先于

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.english: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

name: precaution
trans: 预防，警惕；预防措施

sentences.english: Fire precautions were neglected.
sentences.chinese: 防火措施被忽视了。

sentences.english: Vets took precautions to prevent the spread of the disease.
sentences.chinese: 兽医们为防止疾病蔓延采取了预防措施。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant from happening

name: precedent
trans: 在前的，在先的，优先的

sentences.english: The Obama administration and police officers around the country say no, and their precedent is the past.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马政府和全国各地的警官说不可以，他们引为依据的先例就是“过去”。

sentences.english: There is no historical precedent that can tell us what happens to established democracies when most citizens go years, even decades, without an improvement in their standard of living.
sentences.chinese: 没有历史先例能告诉我们，当大多数人民的生活水平在几年、甚至几十年间维持不变时，一个已经确立根基的民主国家会发生什么。

sentences.english: An east London school has set a precedent by fining pupils who break the rules.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦东区的一所学校开创了对违反校规的学生处以罚金的先例。

detailed_translations.english: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions

name: preceding
trans: 在前的，前面的，在先的

sentences.english: As we saw in the preceding chapter, groups can be powerful agents of socialization.
sentences.chinese: 如我们在前一章所见，团组可以是社会化的有力动因。

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming before the time, place, or part mentioned

name: precious
trans: 珍贵的，贵重的

sentences.english: planes delivering precious supplies of medicine and food
sentences.chinese: 运送药品、食品等宝贵物资的飞机

sentences.english: our planet’s precious resources
sentences.chinese: 我们星球上的宝贵资源

detailed_translations.english: something that is precious is valuable and important and should not be wasted or used without care

name: precise
trans: 精确的，准确的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: precision
trans: 精确，精密度

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: stress
trans: 压力，紧张；着重，强调

sentences.english: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.chinese: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.english: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

name: stretch
trans: 伸展，伸直身体；延续，延长；使倾注全力；使竭尽所能

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

detailed_translations.english: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

name: holy
trans: 神圣的，圣洁的

sentences.english: the holy city of Varanasi
sentences.chinese: 圣城瓦拉纳西

detailed_translations.english: connected with God and religion

name: honor
trans: 尊敬，敬意；荣誉，光荣；荣幸，使感到光荣的人或事

sentences.english: For the French team, winning tomorrow’s game is a matter of national honor.
sentences.chinese: 对法国队来说，打赢明天的比赛事关国家荣誉。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

name: honorable
trans: 尊敬的，高尚的；荣誉的，光荣的

sentences.english: They should see themselves as aliens,as exiles, and yet they should see themselves as properly subservient,honorable, well behaved exiles in a Roman context.
sentences.chinese: 他们应该把自己当做入境者，寄居者，并应该把自己看做是,适当屈从的和可敬的，行为良好的在罗马的寄居者。

name: horizon
trans: 地平线；（知识、思想、经验、阅历、兴趣等的）范围，眼界，见识

sentences.english: In the distance, the dot of a boat appeared on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 远处小黑点般的一条小船出现在地平线上。

sentences.english: a course of study that will broaden your horizons
sentences.chinese: 一门能开阔眼界的课程

detailed_translations.english: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

name: horizontal
trans: 水平的，地平线的；水平线

sentences.english: a horizontal surface
sentences.chinese: 水平面

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平的；地平线的；同一阶层的
detailed_translations.english: flat and level

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平线，水平面；水平位置
detailed_translations.english: a horizontal line or surface

name: ingenious
trans: 灵巧的，机灵的；别出心裁的；巧妙的

sentences.english: an ingenious device
sentences.chinese: 精巧的装置

sentences.english: an ingenious cook
sentences.chinese: 心灵手巧的厨师

detailed_translations.english: (of an object, a plan, an idea, etc.) very suitable for a particular purpose and resulting from clever new ideas

name: ingredient
trans: 组成部分，成分

sentences.english: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

sentences.english: The food is home-cooked using fresh ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物是用新鲜的食材在家里烹制的。

detailed_translations.english: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish

name: initial
trans: 最初的，开始的，开头的；词首的

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

name: initiate
trans: 开始，发起；使初步了解；让...加入

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: initiative
trans: 主动性；进取心

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

name: local
trans: 地方的，当地的；局部的

sentences.english: local hospital
sentences.chinese: 当地医院

sentences.english: local residents
sentences.chinese: 本地居民

sentences.english: a local infection
sentences.chinese: 局部感染

detailed_translations.english: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

name: locality
trans: 位置，地点

sentences.english: weather reports from several different localities
sentences.chinese: 来自几个不同地区的天气报告

detailed_translations.english: a small area of a country, city etc

name: locate
trans: 指出（地点或位置）；使...坐落于，位于

sentences.english: The business is located right in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店就在市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or place

name: location
trans: 位置，场所

sentences.english: The main problem for engineers was the location of underground rivers in the area.
sentences.chinese: 工程师们面临的主要难题是要确定该地区地下河的位置。

detailed_translations.english: the act of finding the position of something

name: neglect
trans: 忽视，忽略；疏忽，玩忽

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: negligible
trans: 疏忽的，微不足道的

sentences.english: The damage done to his property was negligible.
sentences.chinese: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too slight or unimportant to have any effect

name: prescribe
trans: 规定，指定；开药方，开处方

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: prescription
trans: 药方，处方；开处方，开药；计划，建议；秘诀

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

name: presence
trans: 出席，到场；存在

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: present
trans: 赠送，给予；呈现，表现；引见，介绍，目前的，现在的；礼物

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: presently
trans: 一会儿，不久；现在，目前

sentences.english: The doctor will be here presently.
sentences.chinese: 医生一会儿就到。

sentences.english: Presently, I fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿我就睡着了。

sentences.english: The range of courses presently available has grown.
sentences.chinese: 目前可选择的课程范围已经扩大了。

detailed_translations.english: in a short time

name: preserve
trans: 保护，保存

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: preside
trans: 主持，主管，担任主席；掌管，领导

sentences.english: I shall be pleased to preside at your meetings.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴主持你们的会议。

sentences.english: Mr Justice Waller, presiding judge for the northeast
sentences.chinese: 沃勒法官，东北地区的首席法官

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a formal event, organization, ceremony etc

name: press
trans: 报刊；新闻界；报道，评论；压力机

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: pressure
trans: 强制，压迫；压力

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: prestige
trans: 威望，威信；影响力

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
sentences.chinese: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

detailed_translations.english: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

name: presumably
trans: 推测起来，大概

sentences.english: It’s raining, which presumably means that your football match will be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，这可能意味着你们的足球比赛要取消。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大概， 可能， 据推测
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you think something is probably true

name: presume
trans: 推测；假定；假设；认为，推定；冒昧，胆敢做某事

sentences.english: They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务怨恨不已。

sentences.english: I presume you're here on business.
sentences.chinese: 我想你是来这儿出差的吧。

sentences.english: "Had he been home all week?"—"I presume so."
sentences.chinese: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it

detailed_translations.chinese: 推测，假定，相信；冒昧，擅自；认定，推定
detailed_translations.english: If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain

name: prevent
trans: 防止，预防

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

name: previous
trans: 先前的，以前的

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: prey
trans: 被捕食的动物，捕获物；受损害者；牺牲品

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: reliable
trans: 可靠的

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: reliance
trans: 依靠，依赖

sentences.english: the country’s heavy reliance on trade
sentences.chinese: 该国对贸易的严重依赖

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is dependent on someone or something else

name: religion
trans: 宗教，信仰；信念，信条

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

name: religious
trans: 宗教的，信教的；虔诚的

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

name: rely
trans: 依赖，依靠；信赖，信任

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

name: straight
trans: 笔直的，整齐的，正直的；直接地；直率地

sentences.english: a long, straight road
sentences.chinese: 一条笔直的长路

sentences.english: Try to keep your legs straight.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把腿伸直。

sentences.english: Always lift with a straight back.
sentences.chinese: 提东西的时候，一定要把背挺直。

sentences.english: her long, straight black hair
sentences.chinese: 她又长又直的黑发

sentences.english: They sat down in a straight line .
sentences.chinese: 他们坐成一直溜儿。

sentences.english: The road was dead straight (= completely straight ) .
sentences.chinese: 那条路是笔直的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直的；连续的；笔直的；正直的；整齐的；异性恋的
detailed_translations.english: something that is straight does not bend or curve

detailed_translations.chinese: 直接地；不断地；立即；坦率地
detailed_translations.english: in a level or correct position

detailed_translations.chinese: 直；直线；直男，直女，异性恋者
detailed_translations.english: the straight part of a  racetrack

name: straightforward
trans: 正直的，坦率的；简单的

sentences.english: In this example, we will use the most straightforward method of all -- writing our object reference to a file that will be picked up by our client.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，我们将使用所有方法中最直截了当的一种 — 将对象引用写入一个文件，该 文件将由客户机选取。

name: strain
trans: 使紧张，尽力使用；拉紧，绷紧；努力，尽力

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: strategy
trans: 战略，策略

sentences.english: the government’s long-term economic strategy
sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

name: strength
trans: 力气，力量；实力，活力，效力

sentences.english: The police force is below strength at the moment (= there are fewer police than there should be ).
sentences.chinese: 目前警力不足。

sentences.english: the strength of a rope
sentences.chinese: 绳子的强度

detailed_translations.english: the number of people in a team, army etc

name: strengthen
trans: 加强，巩固

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

name: strenuous
trans: 努力的，奋力的；顽强的；紧张的；艰辛的，费力的；繁重的

sentences.english: a strenuous climb
sentences.chinese: 艰难的攀登

sentences.english: The doctor advised Ken to avoid strenuous exercise.
sentences.chinese: 医生建议肯避免剧烈运动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧张的；费力的；奋发的；艰苦的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of effort or strength

name: transaction
trans: 办理，处理，交易，事务；会报，学报

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: transfer
trans: 转移，调动；转让，让与；迁移，转移；调动

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: transform
trans: 改变，改造；变换，使改观

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: transient
trans: 短暂的，转瞬即逝的；临时的

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: translation
trans: 翻译，译文，译本

sentences.english: She read the letter and gave us a rough translation (= she did not translate everything exactly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她看了信，给我们大概翻译了一下。

sentences.english: I’ve only read ‘Madame Bovary’ in translation (= not in its original language ) .
sentences.chinese: 我只读过《包法利夫人》的翻译本。

sentences.english: Much of the book’s humour has been lost in translation (= is no longer effective when translated ) .
sentences.chinese: 本书的许多幽默元素已在翻译过程中丢失。

detailed_translations.english: when you translate something, or something that has been translated

name: architect
trans: 建筑师，设计师；缔造者，创造者

sentences.english: But I am an architect.
sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

name: architecture
trans: 建筑学，建筑术；建筑风格，建筑式样

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

name: archive
trans: 档案，档案馆，档案室；把...存档，把...归档

sentences.english: an archive of the writer’s unpublished work
sentences.chinese: 那位作家未发表作品的档案

detailed_translations.english: a place where a large number of historical records are stored, or the records that are stored
to put documents, books, information etc in an archive

name: area
trans: 地区，区域；范围，领域

sentences.english: Only cheeses made in this area may be labelled ‘Roquefort.’
sentences.chinese: 只有这个地区出产的干酪才能被称作“罗克福尔干酪”。

sentences.english: Crime rates are much higher in urban areas.
sentences.chinese: 城镇地区的犯罪率要高很多。

sentences.english: an area of 2,000 square miles
sentences.chinese: 2,000平方英里的面积

sentences.english: The course covers three main subject areas.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程涵盖三大学科领域。

detailed_translations.english: a particular part of a country, town etc

name: arena
trans: 圆形运动场，圆形剧场；斗争场所，竞争舞台，活动场所

sentences.english: a sports arena
sentences.chinese: 运动场

sentences.english: an indoor arena
sentences.chinese: 室内剧场

detailed_translations.english: a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place

name: argue
trans: 争论，辩论，主张，说服

sentences.english: We could hear the neighbours arguing.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到邻居在争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with someone in words, often in an angry way
to persuade someone to do or not do something

name: argument
trans: 争论，辩论；论据，论点

sentences.english: She had a big argument with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她和丈夫大吵了一架。

sentences.english: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.
sentences.chinese: 我们得提出有说服力的论据，证明为何要改变体制。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

name: arise
trans: 形成，产生，出现；上升，升起；起立，起身

sentences.english: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

name: arouse
trans: 使...奋发；引起，唤起，激起；唤醒

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

detailed_translations.english: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone

name: array
trans: 数组；大量；部署；打扮

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: visible
trans: 看得见的，可见的；明显的，有形的

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: vision
trans: 视力，视觉；想象，幻想；目光，眼力

sentences.english: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。

sentences.english: Tears blurred her vision (= made it difficult for her to see ).
sentences.chinese: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

sentences.english: The idea came to her in a vision.
sentences.chinese: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to see

name: visual
trans: 看的，视觉的

sentences.english: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
sentences.chinese: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to seeing

name: vital
trans: 有生命力的；致命的，极其重要的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: vivid
trans: 鲜艳的；生动的，栩栩如生的

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

name: void
trans: 空的；无效的；没有的，缺乏的

sentences.english: Her eyes were void of all expression.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼神一片茫然。

detailed_translations.english: a contract or official agreement that is void is not legal and has no effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 空虚感，寂寞感；真空，空白
