detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great sadness that you have when someone you love dies or when something is taken from you
to make a contract or agreement void so that it has no legal effect

name: volume
trans: 容积，体积；音量，响度

sentences.english: Can you turn the volume up?
sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.english: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

sentences.english: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
sentences.chinese: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

name: consequence
trans: 结果，后果；影响；重要性

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: consequently
trans: 因而，所以

sentences.english: Most computer users have never received any formal keyboard training. Consequently, their keyboard skills are inefficient.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的电脑使用者都没有经过正规的键盘操作训练，因此他们的键盘技巧不够熟练。

sentences.english: The molecules are absorbed into the bloodstream and consequently affect the organs.
sentences.chinese: 这些分子被吸收到血液里，从而影响到器官。

detailed_translations.english: as a result

name: conservation
trans: 保存，保护，避免损失

sentences.english: wildlife conservation
sentences.chinese: 野生生物保护

sentences.english: a local conservation group
sentences.chinese: 当地的一个环境保护团体

detailed_translations.english: the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, forests etc, to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed

name: conservative
trans: 保守的，守旧的

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views
sentences.chinese: 保守的观点

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

name: consider
trans: 考虑，细想；认为，把...看做；体贴，关心

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

name: considerable
trans: 相当大的，可观的

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: considerate
trans: 考虑周到的，体谅的

sentences.english: He was always kind and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 他总是很善良，为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

name: consume
trans: 消耗，花费；耗尽

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

name: consumption
trans: 消费量；消耗；肺结核，肺病

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: dispute
trans: 争论，争执

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: dissolve
trans: 溶解，融化；使溶解，使融化；解散，取消

sentences.english: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
sentences.chinese: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

detailed_translations.english: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it

name: exchange
trans: 交换，调换，兑换；交易，交流

sentences.english: We exchange gifts at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣诞节时交换礼物。

sentences.english: It’s a place where people can chat and exchange ideas.
sentences.chinese: 在这个地方人们可以聊天和交流想法。

sentences.english: Four of my cassettes for your Madonna CD is a fair exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我用四盒磁带换你的麦当娜激光唱片很公平。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something and receive the same kind of thing from them at the same time
the act of giving someone something and receiving something else from them

name: exclude
trans: 拒绝；把...排除在外，排斥

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: exclusive
trans: 专有的，独占的；除外的，排他的；豪华的，高档的；独家新闻

sentences.english: Bel Air is an exclusive suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢华的，高级的；独有的，独享的；排斥的，排他的；不包括…的，不把…计算在内的
detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared
an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

name: stick
trans: 棍，棒，拐杖；粘住，粘贴

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

name: stimulate
trans: 刺激，促使；使兴奋

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: stir
trans: 搅动，搅拌；使微动，移动；引起，激起

sentences.english: Give that pan a stir , will you?
sentences.chinese: 把那锅东西搅一搅，好吗？

detailed_translations.english: an act of stirring something
to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

name: stipulate
trans: 规定，明确要求

sentences.english: Laws stipulate the maximum interest rate that banks can charge.
sentences.chinese: 法律对银行可以收取的最高利率作了规定。

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement, law, or rule stipulates something, it must be done

name: infer
trans: （根据已知事实等）推断，推定

sentences.english: A lot can be inferred from these statistics.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些统计资料可以推断出很多事情。

sentences.english: From the evidence, we can infer that the victim knew her killer.
sentences.chinese: 根据证据我们可以推断出受害者认识凶手。

detailed_translations.english: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

name: inference
trans: 推论，推理；结论，推断结果

sentences.english: There were two inferences to be drawn from her letter.
sentences.chinese: 从她的来信可以得到两种推论。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true, based on information that you have

name: inferior
trans: 下等的，下级的；差的，次的；下级，晚辈

sentences.english: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.chinese: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: wine of inferior quality
sentences.chinese: 劣质葡萄酒

sentences.english: inferior goods
sentences.chinese: 质量低劣的商品

detailed_translations.english: not good, or not as good as someone or something else
someone who has a lower position or rank than you in an organization

name: influence
trans: 影响，感化；势力，权势

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: influential
trans: 有影响的；权势的

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: inform
trans: 通知，告诉，报告；告发，告密

sentences.english: They would inform him of any progress they had made.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.english: My daughter informed me that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it
to officially tell someone about something or give them information

name: information
trans: 情报，资料，消息；信息

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

name: approach
trans: 靠近，接近；找...商量，同...联系；着手处理，开始对付

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: appropriate
trans: 恰当的，相称的

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: approval
trans: 赞成，批准，同意，认可

sentences.english: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.english: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.chinese: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.english: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.english: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.english: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.english: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.english: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
sentences.chinese: 需经议会批准的任命

sentences.english: She looked to Greg for approval.
sentences.chinese: 她指望格雷格同意。

detailed_translations.english: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted

name: approve
trans: 批准，核准，通过；赞成，同意

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: apt
trans: 易于...的；有...倾向的；恰当的；聪明的

sentences.english: ‘Love at first sight’ is a very apt description of how he felt when he saw her.
sentences.chinese: 用“一见钟情”来形容他见到她时的感觉再恰当不过。

sentences.english: She had taught him French and he had been an apt student.
sentences.chinese: 她教过他法语，他一直是个聪慧的学生。

detailed_translations.english: exactly right for a particular situation or purpose

name: conform
trans: 相似，一致，符合；遵照，遵从，适应

sentences.english: The building does not conform with safety regulations.
sentences.chinese: 例句：这座建筑物不符合安全条例。

sentences.english: It did not conform to the usual stereotype of an industrial city.
sentences.chinese: 这和一座常规的工业城市那种千篇一律的格局不一样。

detailed_translations.english: to obey a law, rule etc

name: confront
trans: 使面临，使遭遇；勇敢地面对，正视

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

name: confuse
trans: 使混乱，混淆

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

name: confusion
trans: 混乱，混淆

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

name: congress
trans: 代表大会；美国等国的国会，议会

sentences.english: a congress of the ruling Labor Party
sentences.chinese: 执政党工党的代表大会

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting of representatives of different groups, countries etc, to discuss ideas, make decisions etc

name: connect
trans: 连接，连结；联系，结合

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: connection
trans: 联系；连接

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.chinese: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.english: Students often see little connection between school and the rest of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.english: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.chinese: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
detailed_translations.english: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

name: conscious
trans: 神志清醒的，有...意识的；意识到的，自觉的

sentences.english: I became conscious of someone watching me.
sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

name: continual
trans: 不断的，连续的；（令人厌烦地）反复的，频繁的

sentences.english: five weeks of continual rain
sentences.chinese: 持续了五个星期的降雨

sentences.english: the Japanese business philosophy of continual improvement
sentences.chinese: 日本人精益求精的经营哲学

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time without stopping

name: continue
trans: 连续，继续；持续，不断发生

sentences.english: He will be continuing his education in the US.
sentences.chinese: 他将在美国继续求学。

sentences.english: 英文例句: I felt too sick to continue.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉很难受，无法继续下去了。

sentences.english: 英文例句:The road continues northwards to the border.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 这条路往北一直延伸到边境。

detailed_translations.english: to not stop happening, existing, or doing something

name: continuous
trans: 连续的，持续的

sentences.english: continuous economic growth
sentences.chinese: 持续的经济增长

sentences.english: a continuous flow of information
sentences.chinese: 源源不断的信息

detailed_translations.english: continuing to happen or exist without stopping

name: dismiss
trans: 解雇，免职

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: disorder
trans: 混乱，杂乱；骚乱；失调，疾病

sentences.english: severe eating disorders such as bulimia and anorexia
sentences.chinese: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

detailed_translations.chinese: 混乱， 杂乱， 骚乱
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a lot of people behave in an uncontrolled, noisy, or violent way in public

name: disperse
trans: 分散，驱散，散去

sentences.english: Police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察用催泪瓦斯驱散人群。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分散， 赶散； 消散， 驱散
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

detailed_translations.chinese: 使分散，散开；使消散，消失
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

name: displace
trans: 转移；替代，撤换

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: display
trans: 陈列，展览

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: distribute
trans: 分配，分发；分布，散布

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: distort
trans: 扭曲，扭歪；歪曲，曲解

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: distract
trans: 使转向；使分心，分散（思想）

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

name: evolution
trans: 进化，发展，演化

sentences.english: the theory of evolution
sentences.chinese: 进化论

detailed_translations.english: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: evolve
trans: 使发展，使进化，演变

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: exaggerate
trans: 夸张，夸大，对...言过其实

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: examine
trans: 检查，细查；对...进行考试

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: mock
trans: 嘲笑，嘲弄；模仿，挫败

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: mode
trans: 方式，式样

sentences.english: the most efficient mode of transport
sentences.chinese: 最高效的运输方式

sentences.english: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
sentences.chinese: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

name: model
trans: 模型，原型；样式，模式；模范，典型，榜样

sentences.english: a working model (= one with parts which move ) of a steam engine
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

sentences.english: a top fashion model
sentences.chinese: 顶级时装模特

detailed_translations.english: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

name: moderate
trans: 温和的，有节制的；适度的，中等的

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

name: modern
trans: 现代的，近代的，新式的

sentences.english: Such companies must change if they are to compete in the modern world .
sentences.chinese: 此类公司如果想在现代社会中与别人竞争，就必须有所改变。

sentences.english: They are the youngest children in modern times to face murder charges.
sentences.chinese: 他们是近代面临谋杀指控儿童中年龄最小的。

sentences.english: Smaller families are a feature of modern society .
sentences.chinese: 家庭规模变小是现代社会的一个特征。

sentences.english: Computers are an essential part of modern life .
sentences.chinese: 电脑是现代生活必不可少的组成部分。

sentences.english: a book about modern history
sentences.chinese: 一本关于现代史的书

sentences.english: The original supermarkets were small by modern standards.
sentences.chinese: 最初的超级市场按现代的标准来看是很小的。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time or most recent time

name: modernization
trans: 现代化

sentences.english: For these reasons, the bank chose it as their development tool for their modernization project.
sentences.chinese: 出于这些理由，银行选择它作为其现代化项目的开发工具。

sentences.english: We must achieve modernization of science and technology, otherwise we will lag behind other nations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须实现科学技术现代化，否则我们要落后于其他国家。

name: modest
trans: 谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的，不太大的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: modify
trans: 修改；缓和，减轻；修饰

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: predecessor
trans: 前辈，前任；（被取代的）原有事物

sentences.english: Kennedy’s predecessor as President was the war hero Dwight Eisenhower.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who had your job before you started doing it

name: predict
trans: 预言，预测，预告

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: preface
trans: 序言，引言，前言

sentences.english: ...the preface to Kelman's novel.
sentences.chinese: …凯尔曼小说的前言。

sentences.english: I will preface what I am going to say with a few lines from Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 我将引用莎士比亚的几行诗作为我讲话的开场白。

detailed_translations.english: an introduction at the beginning of a book or speech
If you preface an action or speech with something else, you do or say this other thing first

name: preferable
trans: 更可取的，更好的

sentences.english: Anything was preferable to the tense atmosphere at home.
sentences.chinese: 什么都比家里的紧张气氛好。

sentences.english: In warm weather, clothes made of natural fabrics are infinitely preferable (= much better ) .
sentences.chinese: 天气暖和的时候，穿天然织物的衣服要舒适得多。

detailed_translations.english: better or more suitable

name: preference
trans: 偏爱，喜爱；优待，优惠，优先权

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: prejudice
trans: 偏见，成见，歧视；损害，侵害

sentences.english: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.english: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

detailed_translations.english: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

name: preliminary
trans: 预备的，初步的

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition
sentences.chinese: 竞赛的预赛阶段

sentences.english: a preliminary draft
sentences.chinese: 初稿

detailed_translations.english: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 初步做法， 起始行为

name: premier
trans: 首相，总理

sentences.english: one of Dublin’s premier hotels
sentences.chinese: 都柏林最好的酒店之一

detailed_translations.english: best or most important
a  prime minister  – used in news reports

name: premise
trans: 前提，假定；作出前提；提出...作为前提条件；假定

sentences.english: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
sentences.chinese: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。

sentences.english: business premises
sentences.chinese: 企业经营场所

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋和地基， 经营场址； 前提， 假设
detailed_translations.english: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

name: premium
trans: 额外费用，奖金，奖赏；保险费；学费，习艺费

sentences.english: premium ice cream
sentences.chinese: 优质冰激凌

sentences.english: the current consumer trend for premium products
sentences.chinese: 当前消费者喜欢购买优质产品的趋向

sentences.english: premium quality British potatoes
sentences.chinese: 优质英国马铃薯

detailed_translations.chinese: 高级的，优质的；售价高的
detailed_translations.english: of very high quality

detailed_translations.chinese: 保险金；额外费用，加付款；奖品，赠品；额外津贴
detailed_translations.english: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year

name: preparation
trans: 准备，预备；制剂，制备品

sentences.english: This dish is good for dinner parties because much of the preparation can be done ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜适合宴会，因为很多准备工作可以事先做好。

sentences.english: Plans for the new school are now in preparation .
sentences.chinese: 新学校的设计图正在绘制中。

sentences.english: a course in food service and food preparation
sentences.chinese: 餐饮服务和备菜课程

detailed_translations.english: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

name: reflect
trans: 反映，表现；反省，细想

sentences.english: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

name: reflection
trans: 影像，倒影；考虑，沉思，想法，见解

sentences.english: Can you see your reflection in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: reform
trans: 改革，改良，改进；改造，改过自新

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

name: reject
trans: 拒绝，抵制，驳回；改造，改过自新

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: rejoice
trans: 使感到高兴，使充满喜悦

sentences.english: Today you may rejoice because of contacts, news or visits from friends who live in another city or country.
sentences.chinese: 今天您可能因为得到来自另一个城市或国家的朋友的联系、消息或拜访而感到高兴。

sentences.english: Why is it that we rejoice at a birth and grieve at a funeral? Is it because we are not the person concerned?
sentences.chinese: 我们为何在（人家）出生之时高兴而在殡殓之时又悲伤呢？是否因为我们不属于关人士才这样的？

name: relate
trans: 讲述，叙述；使相互关联，联系

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: relation
trans: 关系，联系；亲属，亲戚

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

name: relationship
trans: 关系，联系

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: relative
trans: 亲戚，亲属；比较的，相对的；有关的，相关的

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: relativity
trans: 相关性，相对论

sentences.english: They teach the relativity of all ethical ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他们宣扬一切道德观念的相对性。

sentences.english: Einstein put forward his new theory of relativity.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦提出了相对论的新学说。

sentences.english: Everyone was talking about relativity, not only the scientists, but the philosophers and the writers of columns in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都在谈论相对论，不仅仅是科学家，甚至哲学家和报纸的专栏作者也是如此。

detailed_translations.english: the relationship in  physics  between time, space, and movement according to Einstein’s  theory

name: relevant
trans: 有关的，切题的；相关联的，相称的；有重大关系的；有意义的

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: overlook
trans: 俯瞰，眺望；看漏，忽略；宽容，放任

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: overseas
trans: 外国的，海外的；在海外，在国外

sentences.english: Chris is going to work overseas.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯要去国外工作。

sentences.english: Most applications came from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 大部分申请来自海外。

detailed_translations.english: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: stand
trans: 站，站立；坐落，位于；坚持，维持现状；经受，忍受

sentences.english: It looks like we’ll have to stand – there are no seats left.
sentences.chinese: 看来我们只能站着——没有座位了。

sentences.english: She stood in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 她站在门口。

sentences.english: (= do not move ) and listen to me.
sentences.chinese: 站好别动，听我说。

sentences.english: Don’t just stand there (= stand and not do anything ) – help me!
sentences.chinese: 不要光站在那里，帮帮我！

detailed_translations.english: to support yourself on your feet or be in an upright position
used to say that you do not like someone or something at all, or that you think that something is extremely unpleasant
a piece of furniture or equipment used to hold or support something

name: standard
trans: 品质的标准，水平，规格，规范；普通的，正常的，标准的

sentences.english: Students have to reach a certain standard or they won’t pass.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须达到某一标准，否则无法通过。

sentences.english: The airline has rigorous safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家航空公司有严格的安全标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准；水准；旗；度量衡标准
detailed_translations.english: the level that is considered to be acceptable, or the level that someone or something has achieved

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准的；合规格的；公认为优秀的
detailed_translations.english: accepted as normal or usual

name: standpoint
trans: 立场，观点

sentences.english: a discussion of marriage from the standpoint of women
sentences.chinese: 从女性角度对婚姻的探讨

detailed_translations.english: a way of thinking about people, situations, ideas etc

name: stance
trans: （公开表明的）观点，态度，立场；（尤指体育运动中的）站立姿势

sentences.english: a fighting stance
sentences.chinese: 搏击姿势

detailed_translations.chinese: 立场；姿态；位置；准备击球姿势
detailed_translations.english: an opinion that is stated publicly

name: start
trans: 开始，动手；动身，出发；开动，启动

sentences.english: There’s so much to do. I don’t know where to start.
sentences.chinese: 有那么多的事情要做，我都不知道从哪里开始。

sentences.english: She wanted to start her own catering business.
sentences.chinese: 她想自己创立一家餐饮公司。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it

name: startle
trans: 惊讶，惊吓，使吃惊

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我不是故意吓你一跳的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

name: starve
trans: 挨饿，饿死；急需，渴望

sentences.english: Thousands of people will starve if food doesn’t reach the city.
sentences.chinese: 如果食品不能运到那座城市，成千上万的人就要饿死。

sentences.english: pictures of starving children
sentences.chinese: 饥饿儿童的照片

sentences.english: They’ll either die from the cold or starve to death (= die from lack of food ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们要么会冻死，要么会饿死。

detailed_translations.english: to suffer or die because you do not have enough to eat

name: state
trans: 状态，情况；国，州；陈述，说明

sentences.english: She was in an extremely confused state of mind .
sentences.chinese: 她思绪纷乱。

sentences.english: She can’t go home now. Look at the state of her!
sentences.chinese: 她现在不能回家。看看她这副样子！

sentences.english: The country was in a state of war (= officially fighting a war ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个国家正处于战争状态。

sentences.english: Water exists in three states: liquid, gaseous, and solid.
sentences.chinese: 水有三种形态: 液态、气态和固态。

sentences.english: ...reform of the state social-security system.
sentences.chinese: …国家社会保障体制的改革。

detailed_translations.english: the physical or mental condition that someone or something is in
to formally say or write a piece of information or your opinion
State industries or organizations are financed and organized by the government rather than private companies

name: statement
trans: 声明，陈述

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

name: statesman
trans: 政治家，国务活动家

sentences.english: a respected elder statesman
sentences.chinese: 一位受人尊敬的政界元老

detailed_translations.english: a political or government leader, especially one who is respected as being wise and fair

name: statistics
trans: 统计数字，统计数据，统计资料；统计学

sentences.english: crime/unemployment, etc. statistics
sentences.chinese: 犯罪、失业等统计资料

sentences.english: According to official statistics the disease killed over 500 people.
sentences.chinese: 根据官方的统计数字，500多人死于这种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of information shown in numbers

name: statue
trans: 塑像，雕塑

sentences.english: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。

sentences.english: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
sentences.chinese: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

detailed_translations.english: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

name: status
trans: 地位，身份，职业；情形，状况

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

name: statute
trans: 法令，法规，规则，章程，条例

sentences.english: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute (= established by law ) .
sentences.chinese: 保障消费者权益已有法律明文规定。

detailed_translations.english: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

name: stay
trans: 停留；保持；逗留

sentences.english: They stayed all afternoon chatting.
sentences.chinese: 他们待了整个下午聊天。

sentences.english: She stayed late to finish the report.
sentences.chinese: 为了完成报告，她工作到很晚。

detailed_translations.english: to remain in a place rather than leave
a limited time of living in a place

name: steady
trans: 稳的，牢固的，不摇晃的；坚定的，扎实的

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

name: steer
trans: 掌舵，驾驶；带领，指导；沿着道路等前进

sentences.english: He was steering with only one hand.
sentences.chinese: 他只用一只手在驾驶。

detailed_translations.english: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel

name: stem
trans: 茎，干；词干；制止，阻止，遏制；起源于某事物

sentences.english: ‘Writ ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes ’, ‘writing ’ and ‘written ’.
sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

name: step
trans: 脚步；台阶，阶梯；步骤，措施

sentences.english: a video of baby’s first steps
sentences.chinese: 一盒婴儿学步的录像带

sentences.english: He took one step and fell.
sentences.chinese: 他走了一步就跌倒了。

sentences.english: I had to retrace my steps (= go back the way I came ) several times before I found the shop.
sentences.chinese: 我来回走了几次才找到那家商店。

sentences.english: This is the first step in reforming the welfare system.
sentences.chinese: 这是福利制度改革的第一步。

sentences.english: Jenny sat on the step in front of the house, waiting.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮坐在房前的台阶上等着。

sentences.english: I accidentally stepped in a puddle.
sentences.chinese: 我不小心踩进了水坑。

detailed_translations.english: the movement you make when you put one foot in front of or behind the other when walking
to bring your foot down on something

name: stern
trans: 严厉的，严肃的，严格的；船尾，飞机尾部

sentences.english: It is placed in the stern of a boat.
sentences.chinese: 它被放在船尾。

detailed_translations.english: the back of a ship
serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

name: anonymous
trans: 匿名的，无名的；无特色的

sentences.english: the anonymous author of a collection of poems
sentences.chinese: 一本诗集的佚名作者

sentences.english: According to one employee, who wishes to remain anonymous , the company engaged in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 根据一位不愿透露姓名的员工所述，这家公司曾从事非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: unknown by name

name: answer
trans: 答案，回答；响应

sentences.english: Does this answer your requirements?
sentences.chinese: 这个符合你的要求吗？

detailed_translations.english: to be suitable for sth; to match sth

name: anticipate
trans: 预期，预料，期望；使提前发生

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

name: anxiety
trans: 焦虑，担心，不安；焦虑的原因，担忧的事，心事；渴望，热望

sentences.english: his feelings of anxiety
sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being very worried about something

name: anxious
trans: 焦虑的，发愁的；渴望的，急切的

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: apart
trans: 分离，分开；单独地，个别地；分离的；意见不一致的

sentences.english: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.chinese: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.english: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.chinese: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.english: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.chinese: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.english: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.english: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
sentences.chinese: 他们对一场表演的概念和我们的概念相去甚远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成距离，相间隔；分开，除去
detailed_translations.english: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

name: assassinate
trans: 暗杀，行刺；中伤，破坏（名誉等）

sentences.english: a plot to assassinate the President
sentences.chinese: 刺杀总统的阴谋

detailed_translations.english: to murder an important person

name: assault
trans: 攻击，袭击；强暴

sentences.english: Two men assaulted him after he left the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他离开酒吧之后遭到两名男子的袭击。

sentences.english: The refugee camp came under assault again last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚难民营再次遭袭。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone in a violent way
a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

name: assemble
trans: 集合，召集；装配，组装

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: assembly
trans: 集合，集会；装配，安装

sentences.english: Police have imposed conditions on public assemblies.
sentences.chinese: 警方给公共集会设置了条件。

sentences.english: Restrictions on freedom of assembly have gradually been relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 对集会自由的限制渐渐放宽了。

sentences.english: an assembly point
sentences.chinese: 集合地点

sentences.english: instructions for assembly
sentences.chinese: 装配说明（书）

detailed_translations.english: the meeting together of a group of people for a particular purpose

name: assert
trans: 主张，维护；肯定地说出，坚定地断言

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: component
trans: 组成的，整体中的一部分；组成部分，成分，部件

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: compose
trans: 组成，构成；创作（音乐、文学作品），为...谱曲；使（自己、思想等）准备好，使平静

sentences.english: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
sentences.chinese: 巴林顿为新版的《仲夏夜之梦》谱了曲。

sentences.english: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水由氢和氧组成。

detailed_translations.english: to write a piece of music

name: composition
trans: 作品，作文；作词，作曲；结构，组成

sentences.english: Some minerals have complex chemical compositions.
sentences.chinese: 有些矿物的化学构成很复杂。

sentences.english: a composition by jazzman Dave Brubeck, called ‘Chromatic Fantasy’
sentences.chinese: 爵士音乐家戴夫•布鲁贝克的作品《半音阶幻想曲》

sentences.english: The Journals contain accounts of literary composition.
sentences.chinese: 《期刊》中有关于文学创作的报道。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is made up of different parts, things, or members

name: comprehend
trans: 理解，了解

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: comprehension
trans: 理解（力），了解；（听力或阅读）理解测试

sentences.english: Why you let her talk you into doing such a foolish thing is beyond my comprehension (= impossible for me to understand ) .
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会被她说服去做这种蠢事，我实在是无法理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解， 理解力， 领悟； 理解力测验
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand something

name: comprehensive
trans: 广泛的，综合的；全部的；有理解力的

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: condemn
trans: 谴责；宣告（某人）有罪，判刑

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: condense
trans: 使压缩，使凝结，使简洁

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: condition
trans: 状况，状态；环境，情况

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: conditioning
trans: 训练；熏陶；条件作用

name: conduct
trans: 行为，举止，品行；引导，带领；处理，管理

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: conductor
trans: 领队，（乐队）指挥；售票员，列车员；导体，导线

sentences.english: He showed his ticket to the conductor and got on.
sentences.chinese: 他向检票员出示了车票，然后上了车。

sentences.english: The conductor's eyes darted to Wilfred, then fixed on Michael again.
sentences.chinese: 乐队指挥飞快地扫了威尔弗雷德一眼，然后视线又落回到迈克尔身上。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to collect payments from passengers on a bus

name: disable
trans: 使残废

sentences.english: She did all this tendon damage and it really disabled her.
sentences.chinese: 她肌腱受了这么多损伤，这真地使她致残了。

detailed_translations.english: If an injury or illness disables someone, it affects them so badly that it restricts the way that they can live their life

name: disappear
trans: 不见，消失

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: disappoint
trans: 使失望，使扫兴

sentences.english: I hated to disappoint her.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让她失望。

sentences.english: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.chinese: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

name: discipline
trans: 纪律、训练、自制力；训练方法；行为准则；学科，专业，科目

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: disclose
trans: 揭露，透露，使公开

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: discover
trans: 发现

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

name: discovery
trans: 发现；被发现的事物

sentences.english: the discovery of oil in Alaska
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

sentences.english: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

detailed_translations.english: when someone discovers something

name: hoist
trans: 举起，升起，吊起

sentences.english: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
sentences.chinese: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

detailed_translations.english: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

name: hold
trans: 拿着，抓住；抑制，控制；容纳，装得下

sentences.english: She was holding a large box.
sentences.chinese: 她提着一只大箱子。

sentences.english: I held the mouse by its tail.
sentences.chinese: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。

sentences.english: Employees hold 30% of the shares.
sentences.chinese: 雇员持有30%的股份。

detailed_translations.english: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

name: holder
trans: 持有者，占有者；支持物

sentences.english: the 800 m world record holder
sentences.chinese: 800米世界纪录保持者

sentences.english: Season-ticket holders are furious at the rise in rail fares.
sentences.chinese: 买季票的人对火车票价上涨极为愤怒。

sentences.english: British passport holders
sentences.chinese: 英国护照持有人

detailed_translations.chinese: 持有人；所有人；固定器；（台、架等）支持物
detailed_translations.english: someone who owns or controls something

name: household
trans: 户，家庭，全家人

sentences.english: household chores
sentences.chinese: 家务杂活

sentences.english: ...growing up in a male-only household.
sentences.chinese: …在全体成员均为男性的家庭里长大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭的， 家喻户晓的
detailed_translations.english: relating to looking after a house and the people in it
A household is all the people in a family or group who live together in a house

name: however
trans: 无论如何，不管怎样；然而，不过；不管用什么方法

sentences.english: This is a cheap and simple process. However, there are dangers.
sentences.chinese: 这是个花钱少而又简单的方法，不过有危险。

sentences.english: an extremely unpleasant disease that is, however, easy to treat
sentences.chinese: 一种让人极其难受却容易治疗的病

sentences.english: However you look at it, it's going to cost a lot.
sentences.chinese: 不管你怎么看，它都要花很多钱。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are adding a fact or piece of information that seems surprising, or seems very different from what you have just said

name: huddle
trans: 蜷缩；聚集在一起

sentences.english: We lay huddled together for warmth.
sentences.chinese: 我们紧紧挤在一起取暖。

sentences.english: Off to one side, Sticht, Macomber, Jordan, and Kreps huddled to discuss something.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂希特、麦康伯、乔丹和克雷普斯走到一边，私下商量起事情。

sentences.english: The president has been huddling with his most senior aides.
sentences.chinese: 总统一直在和他的顶级高级助理们秘密地聚到一起进行商谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 聚集在一起，挤作一团；把身子蜷成一团，蜷缩
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people huddle together, they stay very close to each other, especially because they are cold or frightened
If people huddle in a group, they gather together to discuss something quietly or secretly

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤在一起的人； 一堆杂乱的东西
detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are close together, but not arranged in any particular order, pattern, or system

name: narrative
trans: 叙述性的；叙述

sentences.english: The novel contains more narrative than dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 这部小说里的叙述比对话多。

sentences.english: If this story must be written, we must have the courage to eliminate all adjectives that tend to excite wonder: they would achieve the opposite effect, of impoverishing the narrative.
sentences.chinese: 如果必须要写这篇故事，我们必须要有勇气剔除易于激发我们想入非非的所有形容词：这些词会使叙述贫瘠无力，起到相反的效果。

detailed_translations.english: a description of events in a story, especially in a novel

name: narrow
trans: 狭窄的，狭的；狭隘的

sentences.english: The stairs were very narrow.
sentences.chinese: 楼梯非常狭窄。

sentences.english: a long, narrow band of cloud
sentences.chinese: 窄长的云带

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a small distance from one side to the other, especially in relation to the length

name: nasty
trans: 龌龊的，肮脏的；下流的，低级的

sentences.english: a nasty temper
sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.english: the nasty things that were being written about her
sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.english: Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant

name: nation
trans: 民族，国家

sentences.english: the President’s radio broadcast to the nation
sentences.chinese: 总统对全国的广播讲话

sentences.english: an independent nation
sentences.chinese: 独立的国家

sentences.english: the world’s leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 世界上的主要工业国

sentences.english: the Cherokee nation
sentences.chinese: 切罗基族

detailed_translations.english: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure

name: national
trans: 民族的，国家的，国立的

sentences.english: Religion matters very much at a national level.
sentences.chinese: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。

sentences.english: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 1929至1933年间，美国的国民收入下降过半。

sentences.english: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
sentences.chinese: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

detailed_translations.english: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts

name: nationality
trans: 国籍；民族

sentences.english: people of the same nationality
sentences.chinese: 同国籍的人

sentences.english: the different nationalities within the former USSR
sentences.chinese: 前苏联的各个民族

detailed_translations.english: the state of being legally a citizen of a particular country

name: native
trans: 本地的，本国的；天生的；本地人，本国人

sentences.english: Singapore has many native species of palm.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡有很多土生的棕榈树种。

sentences.english: You can always tell the difference between the tourists and the natives.
sentences.chinese: 游客与当地人之间的区别一望即知。

detailed_translations.english: growing, living, produced etc in one particular place
someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

name: natural
trans: 自然的，天然的；天生的，天赐的；固有的

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

name: nature
trans: 自然界，大自然；性质，本性，天性

sentences.english: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.english: nature conservation
sentences.chinese: 自然保护

sentences.english: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.english: I tried appealing to his better nature (= his feelings of kindness ) but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
sentences.chinese: 我想唤起他的善良本性，但他就是不同意帮助我们。

sentences.english: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
sentences.chinese: 从本质而言，资本主义社会是不稳定的。

detailed_translations.english: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

name: overall
trans: 全面的，综合的，总体的；总体上，总的来说

sentences.english: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
sentences.chinese: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。

sentences.english: The overall result is an increase in population.
sentences.chinese: 总的结果是人口增加。

sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。

sentences.english: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们不需要全部细节，只要知道大致的情况。

detailed_translations.english: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
considering or including everything

name: overcome
trans: 克服，战胜

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: overlap
trans: 重叠，部分重叠

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: portion
trans: 一部分，食物的一份；把...分成若干份，分配

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: possibility
trans: 可能，可能性；可能的事，希望；机会，契机

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

name: possible
trans: 可能的，做得到的，潜在的，可能发生的；可以接受的，合适的，合理的；合适的人，可能出现的事物

sentences.english: Is it possible to get tickets for the game?
sentences.chinese: 有没有可能弄到比赛的门票？

sentences.english: It might be possible for the documents to be sent over.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件也许可以发送过去。

sentences.english: Computer technology makes it possible for many people to work from home.
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术让很多人可以在家里工作。

sentences.english: I want to avoid the rush hour traffic if possible .
sentences.chinese: 如有可能我想避开交通高峰时间。

sentences.english: I walk or use public transport whenever possible .
sentences.chinese: 只要有可能我就步行或者乘坐公共交通工具。

sentences.english: We are doing everything possible to track down the killer.
sentences.chinese: 我们正竭尽全力追捕杀人凶手。

sentences.english: Our staff will help you in every way possible .
sentences.chinese: 我们的员工会尽力帮助你。

sentences.english: Even if it were technically possible , we do not have the money to do it.
sentences.chinese: 即使技术上可行，我们也没有钱去做。

sentences.english: She decided to stay as far away from him as was humanly possible .
sentences.chinese: 她决定尽可能离他远点。

detailed_translations.english: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved

name: potential
trans: 潜在性，可能性；潜力；潜能

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: pour
trans: 下倾盆大雨；倾注；倾泻，涌流

sentences.english: She poured coffee for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 她为每个人都倒了咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid or other substance flow out of or into a container by holding it at an angle
if a lot of liquid or smoke pours out, it comes out from somewhere in very large amounts

name: remote
trans: （时间，距离）遥远的，偏僻的；关系疏远的，冷淡的；相差很大的

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: remove
trans: 搬迁，移动；移开，挪走；开除，撤职

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

name: removal
trans: 移动，迁居；除去，切除；免职，开除

sentences.english: the removal of rubbish
sentences.chinese: 移除垃圾

sentences.english: stain removal
sentences.chinese: 去污

detailed_translations.english: when something is taken away from, out of, or off the place where it is

name: remain
trans: 剩下，余留；留待，尚需；仍然是，依旧是，保持不变

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: remainder
trans: 剩余物，剩余时间；余数，余项

sentences.english: The remainder must be paid by the end of June.
sentences.chinese: 剩余款项必须在6月底之前支付。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人
detailed_translations.english: the part of something that is left after everything else has gone or been dealt with

name: remains
trans: 残余物；遗迹，废墟；遗体

sentences.english: extensive Roman remains (= of ancient buildings ) at Arles
sentences.chinese: 阿尔勒的一大片古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: the parts of something that are left after the rest has been destroyed or has disappeared

name: remedy
trans: 治疗，治疗法，药品；补救，纠正；革除，消除

sentences.english: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

sentences.english: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善这种情况，水必须进行化学处理。

detailed_translations.english: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation

name: remember
trans: 记得，回想起，不忘记；代...问候；向...送礼

sentences.english: Do you remember Rosa Davies?
sentences.chinese: 你记得罗莎·戴维斯吗？

sentences.english: I can’t remember her exact words.
sentences.chinese: 我记不得她的原话了。

sentences.english: I remember it well ; I’d never seen my mother so angry.
sentences.chinese: 这件事我记得很清楚；我从未见过母亲这么生气。

sentences.english: She clearly remembers the excitement as they boarded the train.
sentences.chinese: 她清楚地记得他们登上火车时的激动心情。

sentences.english: I vaguely remember reading something about it in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 我隐约记得在报纸上看到过有关情况。

sentences.english: They had three children, if I remember rightly .
sentences.chinese: 如果我没记错，他们有三个孩子。

sentences.english: You left your keys on the table, remember?
sentences.chinese: 你把钥匙放在桌子上了，想起来了吗？

sentences.english: I hope he remembers the wine.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他记得带酒。

detailed_translations.english: to have a picture or idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past

name: remind
trans: 提醒，使想起

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

name: render
trans: 使得，使成为；给予，回报；提出，呈报

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: contemporary
trans: 同时代的，同时发生的；现代的，当代的；同代人，（几乎）同年龄的人

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: contempt
trans: 轻视，轻蔑；（对规则、危险等的）藐视，毫不畏惧

sentences.english: The public is treated with contempt by broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 公众受到了节目主持人的轻蔑对待。

sentences.english: How could she have loved a man who so clearly held her in contempt ?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么会爱上一个明显看不起她的男人呢？

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that someone or something is not important and deserves no respect

name: content
trans: 内容，目录；容量，含量；满足的，满意的

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: contend
trans: 竞争，争夺；声称，主张

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: contest
trans: 竞赛，比赛，（控制权或权力的）竞争，争夺；就...提出异议

sentences.english: Stone decided to hold a contest to see who could write the best song.
sentences.chinese: 斯通决定举行一场比赛，看谁能够写出最佳歌曲。

sentences.english: I only entered the contest for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我只是为了好玩才参加这次比赛的。

sentences.english: It is clear that the election will be a close contest .
sentences.chinese: 显然这次选举将是一场难分高下的角逐。

sentences.english: the 1975 Liberal leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 1975年自由党的领导权之争

detailed_translations.english: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 争夺， 与…竞争； 对…提出质疑， 辩驳
detailed_translations.english: to say formally that you do not accept something or do not agree with it

name: context
trans: 上下文，语境；（事件发生的）环境，背景

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

name: contract
trans: 合同，契约；缩小，缩短，缩紧；立约规定（或雇佣、承担、执行等）

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: contradict
trans: 反驳；同...相矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: contrary
trans: 相反的，对抗的；好与人作对的；相反事物，反对，对立面

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

name: contrast
trans: 形成对比，显出明显的差异；对照，对比；差异，差别

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

name: diverse
trans: 多种多样的，不同的

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: diversion
trans: 转向，转移；转移注意力的事物；娱乐，消遣

sentences.english: ...the illegal diversion of profits from secret arms sales.
sentences.chinese: …销售秘密武器所得收益的非法转移。

sentences.english: The party will make a pleasant diversion.
sentences.chinese: 晚会会是一个很不错的消遣。

detailed_translations.english: a change in the direction or use of something, or the act of changing it

name: divert
trans: 转移（某人的）注意力；使转向；挪用资金；使某人得到消遣或娱乐

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

name: divide
trans: 划分，分裂；分配；分开，隔开

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: dividend
trans: 股息，红利，报酬；被除数

sentences.english: The first quarter dividend has been increased by nearly 4 percent.
sentences.chinese: 第一季度的股息增加了近4％。

detailed_translations.chinese: 红利；股息；[数] 被除数；奖金
detailed_translations.english: a part of a company’s profit that is divided among the people with  share s  in the company

name: division
trans: 分开，分配；部门；差异，分歧；除法

sentences.english: the division sign (÷)
sentences.chinese: 除号

sentences.english: the Computer Services Division
sentences.chinese: 电脑维修部

detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out how many times one number is contained in another

name: document
trans: 公文，文件，（计算机）文档

sentences.english: She produces legal documents for a downtown Seattle law firm.
sentences.chinese: 她为西雅图市区的一家法律事务所撰写法律文件。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that has official information on it
to write about something, film it, or take photographs of it, in order to record information about it

name: documentary
trans: 纪录片；文献的，文件的；记录的，纪实的

sentences.english: One of the most useful sources of documentary evidence is maps.
sentences.chinese: 最有价值的文献证据之一就是地图。

sentences.english: ...a TV documentary on homelessness.
sentences.chinese: …一部关于无家可归现象的电视记录片。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of or written on documents
a film or television or a radio programme that gives detailed information about a particular subject

name: execute
trans: 实行，实施，履行；依法处决，处死；执行法令，使法律文件生效

sentences.english: 13 people were summarily executed (= killed without any trial or legal process ) by the guerrillas.
sentences.chinese: 有13人被游击队员就地处决。

sentences.english: The job involves drawing up and executing a plan of nursing care.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作包括拟订和实施一个护理计划。

detailed_translations.english: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment

name: executive
trans: 实行的，执行的，行政的；总经理，董事，高管，行政负责人

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: exemplify
trans: 例示，举例证明

sentences.english: Problems are exemplified in the report.
sentences.chinese: 问题都在报告中作了举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: to give an example of something

name: exert
trans: 用力，尽力；运用，行使，发挥；施加压力等

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: exhaust
trans: 使精疲力尽，使疲惫不堪；用完，耗尽

sentences.english: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
sentences.chinese: 讲一整天课令我精疲力竭。

sentences.english: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
sentences.chinese: 我们面临世界石油储备耗尽的危险。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel extremely tired

name: exist
trans: 存在，实际上有；（尤指在困境或贫困中）生活，生存

sentences.english: The custom of arranged marriages still exists in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家仍存在包办婚姻的习俗。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for students to gain sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 学生有机会获得资助。

sentences.english: Stop pretending that the problem doesn’t exist.
sentences.chinese: 别再假装这个问题不存在了。

sentences.english: We existed on a diet of rice.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃大米过活。

detailed_translations.english: to be present in a place or situation

name: existence
trans: 存在，生存，（尤指艰难或无聊的）生活方式

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: exotic
trans: 异域风情的；吸引人的；漂亮的

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类
