sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

name: moral
trans: 道德上的，道义的；品行端正的；寓意，教育意义

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

name: morality
trans: 道德规范，伦理；美德

sentences.english: the decline in standards of personal morality
sentences.chinese: 个人道德标准的下降

sentences.english: The authorities are protectors of public morality.
sentences.chinese: 当权者是公众道德的捍卫者。

detailed_translations.english: beliefs or ideas about what is right and wrong and about how people should behave

name: moreover
trans: 再者，此外，而且

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

name: mostly
trans: 几乎全部的，主要地，大部分，基本上

sentences.english: Green teas are mostly from China or Japan.
sentences.chinese: 绿茶主要来自中国或日本。

sentences.english: There were about fifteen people in the lounge, mostly women.
sentences.chinese: 大厅里大约有15人，大部分是女性。

sentences.english: He blamed his parents. Mostly he blamed his dad.
sentences.chinese: 他责怪他的父母，主要是责怪他爸爸。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about most members of a group, most occasions, most parts of something etc

name: prior
trans: 先前的，较早的；优先的；更重要的

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: priority
trans: 优先，优先权；（时间，顺序等的）先，前；优先事项

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

name: privacy
trans: 隐居；私事，隐私

sentences.english: each individual’s right to privacy
sentences.chinese: 每个人的隐私权

detailed_translations.english: the state of being free from public attention

name: private
trans: 私人的，个人的；秘密的；私立的，私营的

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: privilege
trans: 特权，优惠；特殊的待遇，特殊的荣幸

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

name: prudent
trans: 谨慎的，小心的；有先见之明的；会打算的

sentences.english: prudent house buyers
sentences.chinese: 谨慎的购房者

detailed_translations.english: sensible and careful, especially by trying to avoid unnecessary risks

name: submit
trans: 屈服，服从；提交，呈递

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: subordinate
trans: 下级的；附属的；次要的

sentences.english: a subordinate officer
sentences.chinese: 下级官员

detailed_translations.chinese: 下级的，级别低的；次要的，从属的
detailed_translations.english: in a less important position than someone else
someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization

detailed_translations.chinese: 使处于次要地位， 使从属于
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something in a less important position

name: subscribe
trans: 捐助，赞助；订阅，订购；同意，签名

sentences.english: My main reason for subscribing to New Scientist is to keep abreast of advances in science.
sentences.chinese: 我订阅《新科学家》的主要原因是要跟上科学的进步。

sentences.english: Each employee may subscribe for up to £2,000 worth of shares.
sentences.chinese: 每位员工最高可以认购价值 2,000 英镑的股份。

sentences.english: The tour of Edinburgh is fully subscribed.
sentences.chinese: 去爱丁堡旅游的名额已经满了。

detailed_translations.english: to pay money, usually once a year, to have copies of a newspaper or magazine sent to you, or to have some other service

name: subsequent
trans: 随后的，后来的

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

sentences.english: subsequent pages of the book
sentences.chinese: 接下去的书页

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming after something else

name: substance
trans: 物质，材料；要旨，基本内容；实质，本质；财力，资产

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

name: substantial
trans: 实质的，真实的；坚固的，结实的；大量的，富裕的；重要的

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: substitute
trans: 代替者，代替物

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

name: subtle
trans: 微妙的，巧妙的；细微的，细致的；细心的，敏锐的；精妙的，灵巧的

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

name: associate
trans: 使联系，使联合；伙伴，合伙人，同事；联合的，联盟的，合伙的

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
detailed_translations.english: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with

name: association
trans: 协会，团体；联合，联系，交往；联想

sentences.english: Scotland has all kinds of happy associations for me.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰给我各种各样愉快的联想。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship with a particular person, organization, group etc

name: amend
trans: 修改，修订；改进，改善

sentences.english: The law was amended to include women.
sentences.chinese: 该法律经修改把女性也包括在内。

sentences.english: The defendant later amended his evidence.
sentences.chinese: 被告后来修改了证词。

sentences.english: ‘Steve stole it – or rather borrowed it,’ he amended.
sentences.chinese: “史蒂夫偷的——应该说是借的。”他改口道。

detailed_translations.english: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken

name: among
trans: 在...之中，在..中间

sentences.english: The girl quickly disappeared among the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 女孩转眼消失在人群中。

sentences.english: I could hear voices coming from somewhere among the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我能听到灌木丛中某个地方传来说话的声音。

sentences.english: We walked among the chestnut woods on the mountain slopes.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在山坡上的栗树林中。

sentences.english: She began rummaging among the books on her desk.
sentences.chinese: 她开始在桌子上的一堆书中乱翻起来。

detailed_translations.english: in or through the middle of a group of people or things

name: amount
trans: 数量，总额；达到...之多

sentences.english: Please pay the full amount (=  of money  ) by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 请在月底前全额付清。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

name: ample
trans: 充足的，丰富的；宽敞的，面积大的

sentences.english: an ample bosom
sentences.chinese: 丰满的胸部

detailed_translations.english: more than enough

name: amuse
trans: 逗乐，逗笑，给...提供娱乐（或消遣）

sentences.english: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.chinese: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.english: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

sentences.english: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.chinese: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone laugh or smile

name: pose
trans: 摆姿势，炫耀；提出（问题、声明等）；陈述（论点等）；产生，引起，造成（问题、困难等）；冒充，假扮

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: position
trans: 位置，地方；地位，身份，等级；职位，职务；立场，态度

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

name: positive
trans: 积极乐观的，自信的；确实的，明确的，肯定的

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: possess
trans: 拥有（某物）具有（某种品质或才能）；支配，控制

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

name: possession
trans: 持有，拥有；所有权；财产，所有物

sentences.english: That information is not in our possession.
sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？

sentences.english: The finance company now has possession of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

sentences.english: We didn’t take possession of (= get and start using ) the car until a few days after the auction.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

name: dilute
trans: 稀释，冲淡；削弱，使减色，降低；稀释的，冲淡了的，掺水的

sentences.english: dilute hydrochloric acid
sentences.chinese: 稀盐酸

detailed_translations.english: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

name: dim
trans: 暗淡的；模糊的；愚笨的，不乐观的

sentences.english: in the dim light of the early dawn
sentences.chinese: 在微弱的晨曦里

sentences.english: a dim glow
sentences.chinese: 昏暗的微光

sentences.english: I could see a dim shape in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 我模模糊糊看见门口有个人影。

detailed_translations.english: fairly dark or not giving much light, so that you cannot see well

name: diminish
trans: 使削弱，减少，缩小；贬低，轻视

sentences.english: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.english: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

name: amateur
trans: （艺术、科学等的）业业余爱好者

sentences.english: a gifted amateur
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的业余爱好者

sentences.english: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
sentences.chinese: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

sentences.english: ...professional athletes and amateur runners.
sentences.chinese: …专业运动员和业余赛跑运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行
detailed_translations.english: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

name: amaze
trans: 使惊愕，使惊异

sentences.english: Dave amazed his friends by suddenly getting married.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫突然结婚，令朋友们非常吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: ambiguous
trans: 含糊不清的，模棱两可的，不明确的

sentences.english: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

sentences.english: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

name: ambition
trans: （对名利等的）强烈欲望，野心；雄心，抱负；追求的目标

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: ambitious
trans: 有雄心的，野心勃勃的；费力的；耗时的；耗资的；艰巨的

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: bubble
trans: 泡，水泡，气泡；幻想的计划，无法实现的意念、希望等

sentences.english: When water boils, bubbles rise to the surface.
sentences.chinese: 水烧开时，水面会冒泡泡。

sentences.english: soap bubbles
sentences.chinese: 肥皂泡

sentences.english: She was blowing bubbles in her milk with a straw.
sentences.chinese: 她用吸管在牛奶里吹泡泡。

sentences.english: Heat the cheese until it bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 把奶酪加热到冒泡。

detailed_translations.english: a ball of air or gas in liquid
to produce bubbles

name: budget
trans: 预期，财政收支状况；做预算，编预算；把...编入预算，按计划花钱

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: build
trans: 体形，体格，身材；建造，建设， 建立

sentences.english: The purpose is to build new houses for local people.
sentences.chinese: 目的是要为当地居民建造新的住宅。

sentences.english: The road took many years to build.
sentences.chinese: 这条路修了好几年。

sentences.english: They needed $3 million to build the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要300万美元来修建这座桥。

sentences.english: It is the female birds that build the nests.
sentences.chinese: 筑巢的是雌鸟。

sentences.english: She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她已经树立起了刑事诉讼律师的声望。

sentences.english: She’s been busy building her career.
sentences.chinese: 她忙于创建自己的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to make something, especially a building or something large

name: business
trans: 商业，生意，营业额；任务，职责，公事；企业，公司，店铺，商号

sentences.english: Students on the course learn about all aspects of business.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程的学生要学习商业活动的各个方面。

sentences.english: Carl began in the music business by running a recording studio.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔是从经营录音棚开始干音乐这一行的。

sentences.english: We do business with a number of Italian companies.
sentences.chinese: 我们和一些意大利公司做生意。

sentences.english: ...recording Ben as he goes about his business.
sentences.chinese: …摄录本做自己的事的样子。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of making money by producing or buying and selling goods, or providing services

name: compress
trans: 压缩，精简，浓缩

sentences.english: Light silk is best for parachutes, as it compresses well and then expands rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 轻质丝绸最适合制作降落伞，因为这种面料便于压缩，而且展开迅速。

sentences.english: Isobel nodded, her lips compressed.
sentences.chinese: 伊索贝尔紧闭着双唇点了点头。

sentences.english: The miners used rock drills and compressed air to drive through hard rock.
sentences.chinese: 矿工使用钻岩机和压缩空气来凿穿坚硬的岩石。

detailed_translations.english: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller
a small thick piece of material that you put on part of someone’s body to stop blood flowing out or to make it less painful

name: comprise
trans: 包含，包括；构成，组成

sentences.english: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子有两间卧室、一间厨房和一间起居室。

sentences.english: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
sentences.chinese: 兼职人员中妇女占了很大一部分。

detailed_translations.english: to consist of particular parts, groups etc

name: compromise
trans: 妥协，折中

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: conceive
trans: 构想出，设想，想象；认为；怀有（某种感情）

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: concentrate
trans: 集中，专心；浓缩物

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: concept
trans: 观念，概念

sentences.english: a new concept in business travel
sentences.chinese: 商务旅行的新理念

sentences.english: our basic concepts of decent human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 我们对得体的人类行为的基本观念

sentences.english: It’s very simple, once you grasp the concept .
sentences.chinese: 你一旦掌握了这个概念之后就很简单了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 概念， 观念； 设想
detailed_translations.english: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done

name: conception
trans: 概念，观念；设想，构想；怀孕，受孕

sentences.english: the conception of parliamentary democracy
sentences.chinese: 议会民主的概念

sentences.english: changing conceptions of the world
sentences.chinese: 这个世界不断变化的观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea about what something is like, or a general understanding of something

name: concern
trans: 关心，挂念；涉及，关系到；关心，挂念

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

name: concise
trans: 简明的，简洁的

sentences.english: Your summary should be as clear and concise as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

detailed_translations.english: short, with no unnecessary words

name: concrete
trans: 具体的，确实的；混凝土；用混凝土修筑，浇混凝土

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: conclude
trans: 结束，终止；断定，下结论；缔结；议定

sentences.english: When the investigation is concluded, the results will be sent to the US Attorney’s office.
sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: conclusion
trans: 结束，终结；结论，推论；缔结，签订

sentences.english: These are the report’s main conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

name: concurrent
trans: 并存的，同时发生的

sentences.english: The exhibition reflected concurrent developments abroad.
sentences.chinese: 该展览反映了国外的同期发展情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并发的；一致的；同时发生的
detailed_translations.english: existing or happening at the same time

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 共点；同时发生的事件

name: confer
trans: 商谈，商议；授予，赋予

sentences.english: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.
sentences.chinese: 他和希尔以及他办公室里的其他人进行了商议。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something with other people, so that everyone can express their opinions and decide on something
to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

name: conference
trans: 会议，讨论会

sentences.english: Representatives from over 100 countries attended the International Peace Conference in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 来自一百多个国家的代表出席了在日内瓦举行的国际和平大会。

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

name: confess
trans: 坦白，承认，忏悔

sentences.english: Occasionally people confess to crimes they haven’t committed just to get attention.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔人们会承认自己并未犯过的罪行，那只是为了引人注意。

sentences.english: Torture was used and Fian confessed.
sentences.chinese: 酷刑用过之后菲安就招供了。

detailed_translations.english: to admit, especially to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal

name: epic
trans: 史诗；史诗般的作品；壮举，惊人之举；具有史诗性质的，史诗般的；艰苦卓绝的，漫长而艰难的

sentences.english: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
sentences.chinese: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事

sentences.english: epic poetry
sentences.chinese: 史诗

detailed_translations.english: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

detailed_translations.chinese: 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品
detailed_translations.english: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

name: epidemic
trans: 流行性的，传染的；流行病；泛滥，传播

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: episode
trans: 片断，一段情节；（连续剧的）一集

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

name: epoch
trans: 时代，纪元，时期

sentences.english: the Victorian epoch
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

sentences.english: The king’s death marked the end of an epoch.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王的去世标志着一个时代的结束。

sentences.english: the beginning of a new epoch
sentences.chinese: 新纪元的开始

detailed_translations.english: a period of history

name: indifferent
trans: 冷淡的，不关心的，不积极的；一般的，平庸的；不偏的，中立的

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: indignant
trans: 愤怒的，愤慨的

sentences.english: an indignant reply
sentences.chinese: 愤慨的回复

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒的， 愤慨的， 义愤的
detailed_translations.english: angry and surprised because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

name: indignation
trans: 愤怒，愤慨

sentences.english: To his indignation, Charles found that his name was not on the list.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯发现他的名字没有出现在名单上，这让他深感愤慨。

sentences.english: He stormed into her office, full of righteous indignation.
sentences.chinese: 他义愤填膺，气呼呼地冲进她的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: feelings of anger and surprise because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

name: indispensable
trans: 必不可少的，必需的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: individual
trans: 个人的，单独的；独特的，有个性的

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

name: mess
trans: 混乱，困境；混杂；脏乱

sentences.english: What a mess!
sentences.chinese: 太乱了！

sentences.english: Sorry – the place is a bit of a mess .
sentences.chinese: 对不起——这里有些乱。

sentences.english: When I got home, the house was a complete mess .
sentences.chinese: 我回到家时，屋子里一片狼藉。

sentences.english: You can make cookies if you promise not to make a mess in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你答应不把厨房搞得乱七八糟，你可以去做甜饼。

sentences.english: She hates mess.
sentences.chinese: 她讨厌到处乱糟糟的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱状态，混乱的局面；困境
detailed_translations.english: if there is a mess somewhere or a place is a mess, things there are dirty or not neatly arranged

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄糟， 弄脏， 搞乱
detailed_translations.english: to make something look untidy or dirty

name: message
trans: 通讯，消息，信息；启示，要旨，主题思想，寓意

sentences.english: The message of the film is that good always triumphs over evil.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影的主题思想是善良终必战胜邪恶。

sentences.english: The result of this legal battle sends an important message to people in similar situations.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼战的结果给情况相似的人们传递了一个重要的信息。

sentences.english: It’s perfectly possible to get your message across (= communicate what you want to say ) without being so angry.
sentences.chinese: 就算不这么生气，你也完全可以把意思说清楚。

sentences.english: They use illustrations to convey their message.
sentences.chinese: 他们用图示来表达他们的意思。

detailed_translations.english: the main or most important idea that someone is trying to tell people about in a film, book, speech etc

name: messenger
trans: 送信者，使者，传令兵

sentences.english: There will be a messenger at the airport to collect the photographs from our courier.
sentences.chinese: 机场会有一名信使从我们的快递员那儿取走照片。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to deliver messages or documents, or someone who takes a message to someone else

name: method
trans: 方法，措施，办法；条理，规律

sentences.english: traditional teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 传统的教学法

sentences.english: I think we should try again using a different method.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们应该用不同的方法再试一次。

sentences.english: effective methods for the storage and retrieval of information
sentences.chinese: 信息存储和检索的有效方法

detailed_translations.english: a planned way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use

name: militant
trans: 好战的，积极从事或支持使用武力的，激进的

sentences.english: militant political activists
sentences.chinese: 激进的政治活动家

sentences.english: a militant animal rights group
sentences.chinese: 激进的动物权利保护团体

sentences.english: After the assassination of Martin Luther King, black leaders became more militant.
sentences.chinese: 马丁•路德•金遇刺后，黑人领袖变得更为激进了。

sentences.english: Even now we could not be sure that the militants would not find some new excuse to call a strike the following winter.
sentences.chinese: 即使到现在，我们也不能确定这些激进分子不会找到某个新的借口在下一年冬天号召一场罢工。

detailed_translations.english: a militant organization or person is willing to use strong or violent action in order to achieve political or social change

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有战斗性的人；好斗者；激进分子
detailed_translations.english: Militant is also a noun

name: military
trans: 军事的，军用的，军队的；军方，军队，军人

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: mind
trans: 头脑，心智，精神，智慧；注意力，心思；介意，在乎

sentences.english: It is impossible to understand the complex nature of the human mind.
sentences.chinese: 要想了解人类思维复杂的特性是不可能的。

sentences.english: Mind and body are closely related.
sentences.chinese: 思想和肉体紧密相连。

sentences.english: Meditation involves focusing the mind on a single object or word.
sentences.chinese: 冥想需要把思想集中在一个物体或单词上。

sentences.english: Sorry─your name has gone right out of my mind.
sentences.chinese: 对不起——我完全想不起你的名字了。

detailed_translations.english: your thoughts or your ability to think, feel, and imagine things

name: redeem
trans: 补救，弥补；挽回影响，改变印象

sentences.english: Olivier’s performance redeemed an otherwise second-rate play.
sentences.chinese: 奥利维尔的表演补救了一出本是二流水平的戏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回；挽回；兑换；履行；补偿；恢复
detailed_translations.english: to make something less bad

name: reduce
trans: 减少，缩小；简化，还原

sentences.english: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。

sentences.english: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

sentences.english: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

name: reduction
trans: 减少，缩小；降低

sentences.english: strategies for noise reduction
sentences.chinese: 减少噪音的对策

sentences.english: The company promised they would make no staff reductions for at least two years.
sentences.chinese: 公司承诺至少两年不裁员。

detailed_translations.english: a decrease in the size, price, or amount of something, or the act of decreasing something

name: refer
trans: 提到，谈到；参考，查阅；询问，查询；提交...仲裁

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: reference
trans: 提及，涉及；参考，参照；查阅；参考节目；推荐信（人）；

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

name: subject
trans: 题目，主题；话题，问题；学科，科目；主语

sentences.english: Paul has strong opinions on most subjects.
sentences.chinese: 保罗在大多数问题上观点激烈。

sentences.english: The subjects covered in this chapter are exercise and nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 本章涵盖的主题是运动和营养。

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目； 学科； 主语
detailed_translations.english: the thing you are talking about or considering in a conversation, discussion, book, film etc
to force a country or group of people to be ruled by you, and control them very strictly

name: subjective
trans: 主观的，个人的

sentences.english: As a critic, he is far too subjective.
sentences.chinese: 作为评论家，他过于主观。

sentences.english: a highly subjective point of view
sentences.chinese: 相当主观的看法

detailed_translations.english: a state-ment, report, attitude etc that is subjective is influenced by personal opinion and can therefore be unfair

name: spoil
trans: 损坏，毁掉；破坏...的兴致（或乐趣等）；宠坏，溺爱

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

name: sponsor
trans: 发起者，主办者，保证人，赞助者；发起，举办，主办；资助，赞助；倡议，发起

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

name: spread
trans: 伸展，展开；散布，传播

sentences.english: The cancer had spread to her liver.
sentences.chinese: 癌已经扩散到她的肝脏。

sentences.english: The news spread like wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 消息如野火般迅速传开。

detailed_translations.english: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

name: spur
trans: 刺激，激励，鞭策；靴刺，马刺；促进，激励，鞭策

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

name: spy
trans: 间谍，密探；当间谍，刺探；搜集情报

sentences.english: That day he spied on her while pretending to work on the shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 那天他假装修剪灌木，却秘密地监视着她。

detailed_translations.english: If you spy on someone, you watch them secretly
someone whose job is to find out secret information about another country, organization, or group
to suddenly see someone or something, especially after searching for them

name: stability
trans: 稳定性，安定性

sentences.english: a period of relative stability
sentences.chinese: 相对稳定的一段时期

detailed_translations.english: the condition of being steady and not changing

name: stable
trans: 稳定的，安定的；沉稳的，持重的，可靠的

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: staff
trans: 全体职员，全体雇员；全体参谋人员，参谋机构

sentences.english: The staff were very good.
sentences.chinese: 员工们都很棒。

sentences.english: 10 staff were allocated to the task.
sentences.chinese: 10名员工被分派做这项任务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体职员，员工；工作人员；参谋
detailed_translations.english: the people who work for an organization

name: stage
trans: 舞台；阶段，时期；步，步骤

sentences.english: We’re getting to the stage where we hardly ever go out together.
sentences.chinese: 我们快要到几乎不一起外出的地步了。

sentences.english: She is on stage for most of the play.
sentences.chinese: 这出戏的大部分时间里她都在台上

detailed_translations.english: a particular time or state that something reaches as it grows or develops

name: choke
trans: 停止呼吸；使人难以呼吸；窒息，噎住；抑制（感情），压制...的成长（或进展、活动等）

sentences.english: I felt as if there was a weight on my chest, choking me.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好像有重物压在胸口，让我喘不过气来。

sentences.english: The smoke was choking me.
sentences.chinese: 烟呛得我呼吸困难。

sentences.english: Weeds were choking the stream.
sentences.chinese: 野草将溪流堵塞了。

detailed_translations.english: if something chokes you, it makes you unable to breathe properly

name: chop
trans: 削减，降低；终止；取消；排骨，肉块

sentences.english: He went outside to chop some more wood for the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他出去再砍些木材来生火。

sentences.english: Can you chop up some carrots for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮我切一些胡萝卜吗？

sentences.english: Add two finely chopped onions and a clove of garlic.
sentences.chinese: 加上两个切碎的洋葱和一瓣大蒜。

detailed_translations.english: to cut something into smaller pieces
to cut something into smaller pieces

name: circumstance
trans: 情况，形势，环境；经济情况，境况

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

name: cite
trans: 引用，引证，举例

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: claim
trans: 要求，主张；索赔；权利

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: clear
trans: 易懂的，明白的；清楚地，清晰地；证明，宣告...无罪

sentences.english: clear instructions
sentences.chinese: 明确的指示

sentences.english: The question wasn’t very clear.
sentences.chinese: 这问题不是很清楚。

sentences.english: It’s the clearest guide I’ve used.
sentences.chinese: 我从没用过这么清晰易懂的指南。

sentences.english: Perhaps I tried to cover too much and didn’t make myself clear (= express myself well ) .
sentences.chinese: 可能是我涉及的内容太多，没有表达清楚。

sentences.english: If you don’t understand, it’s best to say so and get things clear .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不明白，那就最好照直说并把事情弄清楚。

sentences.english: If I catch you smoking again, you’re grounded. Do I make myself clear (= used when you are angry ) ?
sentences.chinese: 如果再让我发现你抽烟，我就罚你不准出门。我的话你听清楚了吗？

sentences.english: Snowplows have been out clearing the roads.
sentences.chinese: 扫雪机已经出动，去清扫路面了。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a simple and direct way so that people understand
to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it

name: border
trans: 边界，边境，边沿

sentences.english: countries that border the Mediterranean
sentences.chinese: 地中海沿岸的国家

sentences.english: ...the European and Arab countries bordering the Mediterranean.
sentences.chinese: …地中海沿岸的欧洲国家和阿拉伯国家。

detailed_translations.english: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it
a band along or around the edge of something such as a picture or piece of material
A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it

name: bore
trans: 使厌烦，使厌倦；令人讨厌的人（或事），麻烦

sentences.english: Get the special drill bit to bore the correct size hole for the job.
sentences.chinese: 找个特殊的钻头，钻个尺寸合适的孔。

detailed_translations.english: to make a deep round hole in a hard surface
something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you

name: born
trans: 出身于...的，天生的，生来的

sentences.english: a born athlete/writer/leader
sentences.chinese: 天生的运动员 / 作家 / 领袖

detailed_translations.english: having a natural ability or skill for a particular activity or job

name: bother
trans: 打扰，烦扰；烦恼，操心

sentences.english: Danny, don’t bother Ellen while she’s reading.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼，埃伦看书的时候不要去打扰她 。

sentences.english: You seem to have got yourself into a spot of bother.
sentences.chinese: 你似乎让自己遇上了点麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: to annoy, worry or upset sb
trouble or difficulty

name: acquire
trans: 取得，获得；学到

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: acquisition
trans: 获得；获得物

name: act
trans: 行动，做事；起作用；表演，扮演

sentences.english: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
sentences.chinese: 公司解雇他做得对。

sentences.english: The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定沃克的行为属于自卫。

sentences.english: Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
sentences.chinese: 只有足够多的民众起来要求，政客们才会采取行动。

sentences.english: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
sentences.chinese: 万一球员摔倒或者被球击中，衬垫可以起到缓冲作用。

sentences.english: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
sentences.chinese: 新总统的第一步行动应当是结束战争。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
one thing that you do

name: action
trans: 行动；行为；战斗

sentences.english: The government must take action (=do something) now to stop the rise in violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在必须采取行动遏止暴力犯罪的上升。

detailed_translations.english: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing

name: activate
trans: 使激活，使活化；使反应加快；启动，开动

sentences.english: Cooking fumes may activate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 烹调时的油烟可能会触发警报器。

sentences.english: The yeast’s growth is activated by sugar and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 糖分和温暖的环境会激发酵母菌的生长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性
detailed_translations.english: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working

name: active
trans: 活跃的；积极的；现行的

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

name: activity
trans: 活跃；行动；活性，活力

sentences.english: Everyone is free to engage in peaceful political activity.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都可以自由参加和平的政治活动。

sentences.english: fund-raising activities
sentences.chinese: 筹款活动

sentences.english: Regular physical activity helps to control your weight.
sentences.chinese: 定期参加体育活动有助于控制体重。

detailed_translations.english: things that people do, especially in order to achieve a particular aim

name: actual
trans: 实在的，实际的

sentences.english: I’m not joking. Those were his actual words.
sentences.chinese: 我没开玩笑，那都是他的原话。

sentences.english: I know Germany won, but I can’t tell you the actual score.
sentences.chinese: 我知道德国队胜了，但我不知道确切的比分。

sentences.english: Interest is only charged on the actual amount borrowed.
sentences.chinese: 利息只按实际借款额收取。

sentences.english: In actual fact (= really  ) , there is little evidence to support the allegations.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这些指控几乎没有证据支持。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is real or exact

name: acute
trans: 有观察力的，敏锐的；剧烈的，激烈的；急性的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: despise
trans: 蔑视，鄙视

sentences.english: She despised her neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 她看不起她的邻居。

detailed_translations.english: to dislike and have a low opinion of someone or something

name: despite
trans: 不管，不顾；即使，尽管

sentences.english: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

name: energetic
trans: 有力的，精力旺盛的

sentences.english: an energetic man
sentences.chinese: 精力旺盛的男子

sentences.english: an energetic drive to get more customers
sentences.chinese: 争取更多客户的十足干劲

detailed_translations.english: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

name: enforce
trans: 强迫，强加；实施，使生效；加强，坚持

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

name: engage
trans: 与...建立密切关系；尽力理解；吸引；占用时间、精力等

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: engagement
trans: 约会，约定；婚约，订婚

sentences.english: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。

sentences.english: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

name: fold
trans: 折叠；褶皱

sentences.english: Fold the paper along the dotted line.
sentences.chinese: 沿虚线将纸折起来。

sentences.english: It’ll fit in if you fold it in half .
sentences.chinese: 对折的话就能放下了。

detailed_translations.english: to bend a piece of paper, cloth etc by laying or pressing one part over another
a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another

name: folk
trans: 民间的

sentences.english: I’m sure there are some folk who would rather they weren’t here.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定有些人宁愿自己不在这里。

sentences.english: Thanks to the folks at NBC.
sentences.chinese: 感谢全国广播公司的工作人员。

sentences.english: Is it OK if I call my folks?
sentences.chinese: 我打电话给家里人可以吗？

detailed_translations.english: people

name: follow
trans: 跟随，接着；领会；沿着...前进，遵循

sentences.english: Are those men following us?
sentences.chinese: 那些人在跟着我们吗？

sentences.english: The patrol car followed the BMW for a few miles and then lost it.
sentences.chinese: 巡逻车跟了那辆宝马几英里，后来就跟丢了。

sentences.english: The conclusion that follows from these findings is that inner city schools need more investment, not less.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些调研得出的结论是，旧城区学校的资金投入需要增加，而不是减少。

detailed_translations.english: to go, walk, drive etc behind or after someone else

name: following
trans: 接着的，下列的

sentences.english: He was sick in the evening, but the following day he was better.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上他生病了，但第二天就好一些了。

sentences.english: Write down the following information: name of product, type, date purchased and price.
sentences.chinese: 写下以下信息：产品名称、型号、购买日期和价格。

detailed_translations.english: the next afternoon, month etc

name: force
trans: 力量，力；势力；强迫，迫使

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: fore
trans: 在前部的；重要的；在船或飞行器的前部

sentences.english: There had been no direct damage in the fore part of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 没有对船的前部造成直接损坏。

detailed_translations.english: the fore parts of a ship, plane, or animal are the parts at the front
the front part
at or towards a ship's bow

name: forecast
trans: 预测，预报

sentences.english: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.english: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

detailed_translations.english: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

name: foresee
trans: 预见，预知

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: forge
trans: 锻造，打铁；稳步前进，缓缓推进；锻造车间，锻铁炉，铁匠铺

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

name: grim
trans: 非常严肃的；严厉的，严峻的；令人不愉快的

sentences.english: ‘I’ll survive,’ he said with a grim smile.
sentences.chinese: “我死不了。”他阴笑着说。

sentences.english: The police officers were silent and grim-faced.
sentences.chinese: 警察默不作声，神情严肃。

detailed_translations.english: looking or sounding very serious

name: grasp
trans: 抓住，抓紧；掌握，领会

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: grip
trans: 抓紧，紧握；吸引住

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

name: gross
trans: 总的；严重的，极端的；粗俗的，下流的

sentences.english: He abused the Admiral in the grossest terms.
sentences.chinese: 他用最粗俗的字眼辱骂那位海军上将。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable

name: ground
trans: 地面，土地；场所；根据，理由

sentences.english: I found her lying on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我发现她躺在地上。

sentences.english: a football/recreation/sports, etc. ground
sentences.chinese: 足球场、娱乐场地、运动场等

sentences.english: There are strong grounds for believing his statement.
sentences.chinese: 有充分的理由可以相信他的话。

sentences.english: ‘You’re under arrest.’ ‘On what grounds?’
sentences.chinese: “你被捕了。”“理由是什么？”

detailed_translations.english: the solid surface of the earth

name: group
trans: 集团，团体；组，群；批；类；簇

sentences.english: He was surrounded by a group of admirers.
sentences.chinese: 他的身边围了一群仰慕者。

sentences.english: The photo shows four men grouped round a jeep.
sentences.chinese: 照片上是四个男人围着一辆吉普车。

detailed_translations.english: several people or things that are all together in the same place
to come together and form a group, or to arrange things or people together in a group

name: guarantee
trans: 保证，保证书，保单；保证，担保

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: guard
trans: 守卫，保卫；守卫，看守

sentences.english: The Sergeant told Swift to guard the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 中士叫斯威夫特守着入口。

sentences.english: a lioness guarding her cubs
sentences.chinese: 守护着幼狮的母狮

sentences.english: There were two security guards on duty outside the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼外面有两名保安在值勤。

detailed_translations.english: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them
someone whose job is to protect a place or person

name: include
trans: 包括，包含，计入

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

name: inclusive
trans: 包括的，包含的；范围广的，包容性强的

sentences.english: The fully inclusive fare for the trip is £22.
sentences.chinese: 这次出行的全部费用为22英镑。

sentences.english: The rent is £120 a week, inclusive of heating.
sentences.chinese: 房租连暖气费在内是每星期120英镑。

detailed_translations.english: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

name: income
trans: 收入，收益

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

name: incorporate
trans: 包含，吸收；合并，混合

sentences.english: It allows you to harness existing technologies and incorporate them into one application.
sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

name: increase
trans: 增加，增长，增进

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: increasingly
trans: 不断增加地，日益

sentences.english: Marketing techniques are becoming increasingly sophisticated.
sentences.chinese: 市场营销技巧越来越巧妙。

sentences.english: Increasingly, young people distrust all forms of government.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人越来越不相信任何形式的政府。

detailed_translations.english: more and more all the time

name: incredible
trans: 难以置信的，惊人的，不可思议的

sentences.english: It’s incredible that he survived the fall.
sentences.chinese: 他跌下去竟然能够生还，真不可思议。

sentences.english: It’s incredible how much Tom has changed since he met Sally.
sentences.chinese: 自从遇见萨莉后，汤姆的变化之大简直令人难以置信。

sentences.english: I find it almost incredible that no one noticed these errors.
sentences.chinese: 没人发现这些错误，真让我无法相信。

detailed_translations.english: too strange to be believed, or very difficult to believe

name: incur
trans: 招致，引起，遭受

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

name: link
trans: 连接，联系；环节，联系

sentences.english: He walked with her, linking arms (= putting his arm around her arm ).
sentences.chinese: 他与她挽臂同行。

detailed_translations.english: to join two things by putting one through the other
each ring of a chain

name: list
trans: 表，目录，清单，名单；把...编列成表，列入表内

sentences.english: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.english: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.chinese: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.english: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

detailed_translations.english: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other

name: literally
trans: 照字面意义地，逐字地；确实地，真正地

sentences.english: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

detailed_translations.english: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

name: literary
trans: 文学上的，文学的

sentences.english: a literary prize
sentences.chinese: 文学奖

detailed_translations.english: relating to literature

name: literature
trans: 文学，文学作品，文献

sentences.english: He has read many of the major works of literature.
sentences.chinese: 他读过许多重要的文学作品。

sentences.english: Italian literature
sentences.chinese: 意大利文学

sentences.english: literature on the history of science
sentences.chinese: 科学史的文献资料

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学，文学作品；文献；文献
detailed_translations.english: books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good

name: memorandum
trans: 备忘录

sentences.english: ...a memorandum from the Department of Defense on its role.
sentences.chinese: …一份来自国防部的有关其角色的备忘录。

detailed_translations.english: a  memo

name: memorial
trans: 追悼的，纪念的；纪念物，纪念碑，纪念馆

sentences.english: A memorial service is being held for her at St. Paul's Church.
sentences.chinese: 一场为她举行的纪念仪式正在圣保罗教堂举行。

sentences.english: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

detailed_translations.english: done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died
something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

name: memory
trans: 记忆，记忆力

sentences.english: He has lots of happy memories of his stay in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 他对在日本逗留的那段时光有许多美好的回忆。

sentences.english: The data is stored in the computer’s memory.
sentences.chinese: 数据储存在电脑的存储器里

detailed_translations.english: something that you remember from the past about a person, place, or experience

name: mental
trans: 精神的，心理的，智力的，脑力的

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

name: mention
trans: 提及，说起

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

name: mentor
trans: 导师，顾问

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

name: other
trans: 另外的，其他的

sentences.english: The other hotels are all full.
sentences.chinese: 其他的宾馆均已客满。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to all the people or things in a group apart from the one you have already men­tioned or the one that is already known about

name: otherwise
trans: 否则，要不然

sentences.english: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.english: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

name: outcome
trans: 结果，成果

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: sign
trans: 标记，符号，招牌；征兆，迹象

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign
sentences.chinese: 减号

sentences.english: a sign on the door
sentences.chinese: 门上的标牌

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

name: signature
trans: 签名，署名，签字

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

name: signal
trans: 信号，暗号

sentences.english: He pressed the red alarm signal to see if it was on or off.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下红色报警信号钮，检查一下它是开著的还是关著的。

detailed_translations.english: important
a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something
to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

name: significance
trans: 重要性；意义，含义

sentences.english: a decision of major political significance
sentences.chinese: 具有重大政治意义的决定

detailed_translations.english: the importance of sth, especially when this has an effect on what happens in the future

name: significant
trans: 有意义的；重要的，重大的

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: signify
trans: 表示，表明，预示；有重要性，要紧

sentences.english: Some tribes use special facial markings to signify status.
sentences.chinese: 有些部落使用特殊的面部标记来表示地位。

sentences.english: The image of the lion signified power and strength.
sentences.chinese: 狮子的形象代表权力和力量。

sentences.english: These figures don’t really signify in the overall results.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字对于总体结果影响不是很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示,意味；要紧,有重要性
detailed_translations.english: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

name: similar
trans: 相似的，类似的

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: simple
trans: 简单的；单纯的，直率的，朴素的；迟钝的，头脑简单的

sentences.english: Completing the race is not just a simple matter of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑完比赛不仅仅是纯粹的体力问题。

sentences.english: I’m afraid Luke’s a bit simple.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得卢克有点笨。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved

name: simplicity
trans: 简单；朴素；直率，单纯

sentences.english: Mona wrote with a beautiful simplicity of style.
sentences.chinese: 莫娜的文笔朴实优美。

sentences.english: For the sake of simplicity, the tax form is divided into three sections.
sentences.chinese: 为简明起见，税单分成三个部分。

sentences.english: James’ solution to this problem was simplicity itself (= very simple ) .
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯对这个问题的解决办法十分简单。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being simple and not complicated, especially when this is attractive or useful

name: simplify
trans: 简化，使单纯

sentences.english: an attempt to simplify the tax system
sentences.chinese: 简化税制的尝试

sentences.english: The law needs to be simplified.
sentences.chinese: 这部法律需要简化。

sentences.english: a simplified version of the game
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏的简化版

detailed_translations.english: to make something easier or less complicated

name: simply
trans: 仅仅，只，不过；确实，简直；简单地，朴素地

sentences.english: Try to express yourself more simply.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把你的意思表达得更简单明了。

sentences.english: To put it simply, the tax cuts mean the average person will be about 3% better off.
sentences.chinese: 简单地说，这次减税意味着普通人的收入将增加 3% 左右。

sentences.english: We had to live very simply on my father’s small salary.
sentences.chinese: 我们只能靠父亲微薄的工资过着非常简朴的生活。

detailed_translations.english: if you say or explain something simply, you say it in a way that is easy for people to understand

name: slack
trans: 不紧的，不严的，松弛的；松懈的，疏忽的

sentences.english: He was accused of slacking and taking too many holidays.
sentences.chinese: 他被指责工作不努力，休假太多。

detailed_translations.english: to make less effort than usual, or to be lazy in your work

detailed_translations.chinese: 懈怠的，马虎的；萧条的，清淡的，不活跃的；松的
detailed_translations.english: hanging loosely, or not pulled tight
part of a rope that is not stretched tight

name: beam
trans: 光束，光柱；横梁；发光，照射

sentences.english: ...high-energy laser beams.
sentences.chinese: …高能激光束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 横梁；光线；电波；船宽；[计量] 秤杆
detailed_translations.english: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
detailed_translations.english: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

name: become
trans: 成为，变得；适宜，同...相称；使人显得漂亮，使好看

sentences.english: The weather became warmer.
sentences.chinese: 天气变暖和了。

sentences.english: Slowly my eyes became accustomed to the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。

sentences.english: Helen became increasingly anxious about her husband’s strange behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 海伦越来越担心她丈夫的反常行为。

sentences.english: Pollution from cars has become a major problem.
sentences.chinese: 汽车污染已成为严重的问题。

sentences.english: When did you first want to become a teacher?
sentences.chinese: 你最早是什么时候想要当一名教师的？

detailed_translations.english: to start to have a feeling or quality, or to start to develop into something

name: deprive
trans: 剥夺，使丧失

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

name: derive
trans: 取得，得到；追溯...的起源

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: describe
trans: 形容，描述

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

name: description
trans: 描述，形容；种类，类型

sentences.english: The booklet gives a brief description of each place.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子对每一个地方都作了简短的介绍。

sentences.english: Berlin sounds fascinating from your description.
sentences.chinese: 从你的描述来看，柏林是个迷人的城市。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

name: deserve
trans: 值得，应得

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

name: design
trans: 设计，绘制；设计，图样

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

name: designate
trans: 指明，标明；指定，指派

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

name: desirable
trans: 称心的，合意的

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

name: desire
trans: 希望，渴望；愿望，欲望，要求

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much
a strong hope or wish

name: flaw
trans: 裂缝；缺陷，缺点

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: flexible
trans: 柔韧的；易弯曲的；可变通的

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: fling
trans: 用力扔，掷，抛，丢

sentences.english: He flung the box into the river.
sentences.chinese: 他把盒子扔进河里。

sentences.english: People cheered and flung their hats into the air.
sentences.chinese: 民众欢呼着把帽子抛向空中。

detailed_translations.english: to throw something somewhere using a lot of force

name: flourish
trans: 繁荣，茂盛，兴旺；挥舞，舞动；炫耀

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: grow
trans: 成为；增长；生长，成长

sentences.english: Support for Mr Thompson is growing.
sentences.chinese: 汤普森先生的支持率在上升。

sentences.english: a tree which will grow well in most types of soil
sentences.chinese: 在大部分土壤里都能生长得很好的一种树

detailed_translations.english: to become bigger, taller etc over a period of time in the process of becoming an adult

name: grown-up
trans: 成熟的，成人的；成年人

sentences.english: Before you know it, the children will be grown-up and leaving home.
sentences.chinese: 转眼之间，孩子们就会长大成人离家而去。

sentences.english: I’ve got two grown-up sons.
sentences.chinese: 我有两个已经成年的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成长的； 成熟的； 成人的
detailed_translations.english: fully developed as an adult
an adult – used by or to children

name: growth
trans: 生长，增长，发展
