sentences.english: He was found not guilty of the death of PC Jones.
sentences.chinese: 关于警员琼斯的死，他被判无罪。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very ashamed and sad because you know that you have done something wrong

name: recognition
trans: 认出，辨认；承认

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

name: recognize
trans: 认出，识别；承认，认可；明白，认识到

sentences.english: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
sentences.chinese: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.english: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.english: One must recognise that homesickness is natural.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认思乡是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past

name: recommend
trans: 推荐；称赞；劝告，建议

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: recover
trans: 追回，重新得到；恢复，康复

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: recovery
trans: 恢复，痊愈；重获

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: recruit
trans: 招募，招收；新兵，新成员

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: sell
trans: 出让；出售；让人失望的东西

sentences.english: If you offer him another hundred, I think he’ll sell.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再加一百元钱，我想他会卖的。

sentences.english: He regrets selling all his old records.
sentences.chinese: 他后悔把所有的老唱片都卖掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone in exchange for money

name: send
trans: 发送，传达；派遣，打发，安排去

sentences.english: Lyn sent some pictures of the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 琳恩寄了几张婚礼照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: [sent-sent] 送， 寄； 派遣， 打发； 发送； 发射
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something to go or be taken to another place, especially by post

name: senior
trans: 年长的；资格老的，地位较高的；成人的；高水平的

sentences.english: Seniors can get a 10% discount.
sentences.chinese: 老年人可以享受10%的折扣。

detailed_translations.english: a  senior citizen

name: smart
trans: 聪明的，伶俐的；有力的，猛烈的

sentences.english: My eyes were smarting with the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛被烟熏得发痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel a sharp stinging pain in a part of your body

name: smell
trans: 气味，臭味；嗅觉；闻到

sentences.english: I can smell burning.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到烧焦的气味。

sentences.english: Can you smell something?
sentences.chinese: 你闻到什么气味了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to notice or recognize a particular smell
the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

name: soak
trans: 湿透，浸湿；渗透，湿透

sentences.english: Soak the clothes in cold water.
sentences.chinese: 把衣服浸泡在冷水里。

sentences.english: Let the pans soak; I’ll wash them later.
sentences.chinese: 把锅泡着吧，我过一会儿再洗。

detailed_translations.english: if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean
if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean

name: soar
trans: 高飞，翱翔；耸立；飞涨；猛增，剧增；高飞范围；高涨程度

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

name: sociable
trans: 好交际的，友善的，合群的；联谊会，联欢会

sentences.english: a pleasant, sociable couple
sentences.chinese: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

detailed_translations.chinese: 社交的；好交际的；友善的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is sociable is friendly and enjoys being with other people

name: social
trans: 社会的，交际的

sentences.english: social issues, such as unemployment and education
sentences.chinese: 失业和教育之类的社会问题

sentences.english: the country’s serious social problems
sentences.chinese: 该国严重的社会问题

sentences.english: a challenge to the social order
sentences.chinese: 对社会秩序的一个挑战

detailed_translations.chinese: 社会的； 交际的， 社交的
detailed_translations.english: relating to human society and its organization, or the quality of people’s lives

name: socialism
trans: 社会主义

sentences.english: They declared for socialism.
sentences.chinese: 他们表示拥护社会主义。

sentences.english: We should rally under the banner of socialism.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当在社会主义的旗帜下团结起来。

sentences.english: From the Left: Yes! Yes, exactly what socialism is.
sentences.chinese: 从左边的回答：是的，这就是社会主义。

detailed_translations.english: an economic and political system in which large industries are owned by the government, and taxes are used to take some wealth away from richer citizens and give it to poorer citizens

name: society
trans: 社会；社团，协会，学会

sentences.english: technology and its effects on modern society
sentences.chinese: 科技及其对现代社会的影响

sentences.english: Children are the most vulnerable members of society .
sentences.chinese: 儿童是最脆弱的社会成员。

detailed_translations.english: people in general, considered in relation to the laws, organizations etc that make it possible for them to live together

name: sociology
trans: 社会学

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: Basic courses in sociology and psychology as well as other humanities courses give students plenty of opportunity to explore their own emotions.
sentences.chinese: 社会学和心理学的基础，以及其他人文学科的课程，赋予学生大量的机会去探索其个人情感。

sentences.english: And I spent part of my second grade year in Sweden, where my father was on sabbatical as a professor of sociology.
sentences.chinese: 因为我父亲休假的缘故，我的小学二年级有一段时间是在瑞典上的，那个时候他是一名社会学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

name: soluble
trans: 可溶的

sentences.english: soluble aspirin
sentences.chinese: 可溶性阿司匹林

detailed_translations.english: a soluble substance can be  dissolved  in a liquid

name: solution
trans: 解答，解决方法；溶液，溶解

sentences.english: The best solution would be for them to separate.
sentences.chinese: 最好的解决方法是他们分开。

sentences.english: he solution of glucose in water
sentences.chinese: 葡萄糖在水中的溶解

detailed_translations.english: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation

name: solve
trans: 解答，解决

sentences.english: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
sentences.chinese: 查理认为钱能解决他所有的问题。

sentences.english: the best way of solving our dilemma
sentences.chinese: 解决我们两难处境的最佳办法

sentences.english: attempts to solve a mathematical equation
sentences.chinese: 解数学方程式的尝试

detailed_translations.english: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

name: detach
trans: 拆卸；使分开，使分离

sentences.english: Please detach and fill out the application form.
sentences.chinese: 请撕下申请表并填好。

detailed_translations.english: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

name: detail
trans: 细节，详情；详述

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something
to list things or give all the facts or information about something

name: detain
trans: 拘留，扣押；留住，耽搁

sentences.english: Two suspects have been detained by the police for questioning .
sentences.chinese: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。

sentences.english: He was detained in Washington on urgent business.
sentences.chinese: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

detailed_translations.english: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

name: shadow
trans: 影子，阴影；暗处，阴暗；虚幻的事物，失去实质的事物；形影不离的人

sentences.english: the long dark shadow of an old oak tree
sentences.chinese: 一棵老橡树长长的影子

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴影；影子；幽灵；庇护；隐蔽处
detailed_translations.english: the dark shape that someone or something makes on a surface when they are between that surface and the light
to follow someone closely in order to watch what they are doing
the group of politicians in the British parliament who would become ministers if their party was in government

name: shade
trans: 荫，荫凉；遮光物，灯罩；为...遮阳，荫蔽；隐瞒，掩饰

sentences.english: a delicate/pale/rich/soft shade of red
sentences.chinese: 淡 / 浅 / 艳 / 柔和的红色

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of red, green, blue etc

name: sort
trans: 种类，类别；分类，整理

sentences.english: Most of the victims developed psychological problems of one sort or another (= of various different types ).
sentences.chinese: 大多数受害者都出现了这样那样的心理问题。

sentences.english: They do burgers, pizzas, that sort of thing.
sentences.chinese: 他们供应汉堡包、比萨饼什么的。

sentences.english: The eggs are sorted according to size.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸡蛋是按大小分类的。

detailed_translations.english: a group or class of people, things etc that have similar qualities or features
to put things in a particular order or arrange them in groups according to size, type etc

name: soul
trans: 精神状况；灵魂，心灵，心

sentences.english: the immortality of the soul
sentences.chinese: 灵魂的不灭

sentences.english: It was as if those grey eyes could see into the very depths of her soul .
sentences.chinese: 仿佛那双灰眼睛能看到她的灵魂深处。

sentences.english: the souls of the dead
sentences.chinese: 亡灵

detailed_translations.english: the part of a person that is not physical, and that contains their character, thoughts, and feelings. Many people believe that a person’s soul continues to exist after they have died.

name: sound
trans: 健康的，健全的，完好的；可靠的，牢固的；正确的，明智的；彻底的，充分的；声音，响声

sentences.english: a sound understanding of money and banking systems
sentences.chinese: 对货币和银行业体制的透彻理解

sentences.english: a sound knowledge of English
sentences.chinese: 扎实的英语知识

sentences.english: He has sound grasp of European history.
sentences.chinese: 他对欧洲历史有着透彻的理解。

detailed_translations.english: complete and thorough

name: sour
trans: 酸的，酸味的；易怒的，尖酸刻薄的

sentences.english: Rachel sampled the wine. It was sour.
sentences.chinese: 雷切尔尝了尝葡萄酒，是酸的。

sentences.english: sour cherries
sentences.chinese: 酸樱桃

detailed_translations.chinese: 酸的；发酵的；刺耳的；酸臭的；讨厌的
detailed_translations.english: having a sharp acid taste, like the taste of a  lemon  or a fruit that is not ready to be eaten
if milk sours, or if something sours it, it begins to have an unpleasant sharp taste

name: source
trans: 河流的源头，发源地

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: advance
trans: 使向前移动；促进；提出建议；提前发生；前进，进展

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: advanced
trans: 高级的，先进的

sentences.english: advanced learners of English
sentences.chinese: 高级程度的英语学习者

sentences.english: advanced physics
sentences.chinese: 高等物理（学）

detailed_translations.english: studying or dealing with a school subject at a difficult level

name: advantage
trans: 有利条件，优点；（尤指采取某一步骤而带来的）好处，利益

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

name: advice
trans: 建议；劝告，忠告，意见

sentences.english: You should have followed my advice.
sentences.chinese: 你真该听我的建议。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion you give someone about what they should do

name: advise
trans: 建议；通知

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

name: advisable
trans: 可取的，适当的

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.
sentences.chinese: 对人家的意见不予理睬是不明智的。

name: advocate
trans: 拥护，提倡，主张；拥护者，提倡者，鼓吹者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: aesthetic
trans: 美学的，艺术的，审美的

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

name: affair
trans: 事情，事件；事务，业务，事态

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: affect
trans: 影响；（悲伤的）感觉，感动

sentences.english: the areas affected by the hurricane
sentences.chinese: 受飓风影响的地区

sentences.english: a disease that affects the central nervous system
sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.english: decisions which affect our lives
sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.english: Trading has been adversely affected by the downturn in consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.english: We were all deeply affected by her death.
sentences.chinese: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

name: affection
trans: 爱，喜爱；感情；疾病，病情

sentences.english: She looked back on those days with affection .
sentences.chinese: 她深情地回顾那些日子。

sentences.english: Their father never showed them much affection .
sentences.chinese: 他们的父亲对他们从来没有表现出多少慈爱。

sentences.english: Anne had two men trying to win her affections.
sentences.chinese: 安妮有两个男人追求。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of liking or loving sb/sth very much and caring about them

name: affiliate
trans: 使隶属，使成为会员；成员，附属机构，分公司

sentences.english: He wanted to affiliate with a U.S. firm because he needed expert advice in legal affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他想成为一家美国公司的会员，因为他需要法律事务方面的专家意见。

detailed_translations.english: if a group or organization affiliates to or with another larger one, it forms a close connection with it
a company, organization etc that is connected with or controlled by a larger one

name: affirm
trans: 断言，肯定；证实，宣誓说实话

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: afford
trans: 付得起；供给

sentences.english: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们再也不能等下去了，否则会赶不上飞机的。

sentences.english: The room affords a beautiful view over the city.
sentences.chinese: 这房间可以俯瞰城市美景。

sentences.english: The new law will afford protection to employees.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将为雇员提供保障。

detailed_translations.english: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you

name: breach
trans: 打开缺口；违反，违背；破坏，中断；裂口，缺口

sentences.english: The congressman was accused of a breach of secrecy rules.
sentences.chinese: 这个国会议员被指控违反保密条例。

detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, rule, or agreement
to break a law, rule, or agreement

name: break
trans: 打断，中止；休息时间；打破，折断

sentences.english: I had to break a window to get into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。

detailed_translations.english: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it

name: breakdown
trans: 倒塌，损坏，故障；垮掉，衰竭

sentences.english: A sudden rise in oil prices could lead to a breakdown of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 油价暴涨会导致经济崩溃。

sentences.english: The breakdown of the negotiations was not unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 谈判的失败是预料之中的事。

detailed_translations.english: a failure of a relationship, discussion or system

name: breed
trans: 养育，培育；繁殖；酿成，产生

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: brevity
trans: 简洁，简练；短暂

sentences.english: Letters published in the newspaper are edited for brevity and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 报上刊登的来信都要编辑得简洁明了。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of expressing something in very few words

name: coincide
trans: 相符，相一致；同时发生

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: collapse
trans: 倒坍，崩溃，瓦解；突然失去价值，暴跌

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: colleague
trans: 同事，同僚，同盟

sentences.english: a colleague of mine from the bank
sentences.chinese: 我在银行的一位同事

sentences.english: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

name: collect
trans: 收集，搜集；领取，接走

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

name: collection
trans: 收藏品，收集物

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: collective
trans: 集体；集体的，共同的

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: collide
trans: 碰撞，互撞；冲突，抵触

sentences.english: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 两辆火车迎头相撞。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

name: column
trans: 圆柱，柱状物

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: combat
trans: 战斗，搏斗

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

name: combine
trans: 使结合，使化合

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

name: command
trans: 命令，指令；统帅，指挥；掌握，运用能力

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

name: commend
trans: 表扬，称赞；托付，委托

sentences.english: The paper was highly commended in the UK Press Awards.
sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。

sentences.english: Colleagues, I commend this report to you.
sentences.chinese: 各位同事，我向你们推荐这份报告。

detailed_translations.english: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

name: comment
trans: 评论，意见

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

name: commerce
trans: 商业，贸易

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

name: commercial
trans: 商业的，贸易的

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: commission
trans: 委员会；委任，委托书；佣金，手续费

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: commit
trans: 提交；把..交托给；犯错误，干坏事

sentences.english: Women commit fewer crimes than men.
sentences.chinese: 女性犯罪比男性少。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯， 干； 使承诺； 把…托付给； 调拨…供使用， 拨出
detailed_translations.english: to do something wrong or illegal

name: committee
trans: 委员会，全体委员

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: commodity
trans: 商品，物品

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

name: common
trans: 普通的，常见的；共同的，公共的；公用，公有；公用草地

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: communicate
trans: 传达，表达；交流；通讯，通话

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: communication
trans: 通讯，传达，交流；通讯系统；交通工具

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

name: communism
trans: 共产主义，共产主义学说，共产主义制度

sentences.english: ...the ultimate triumph of communism in the world.
sentences.chinese: …共产主义在全世界的最终胜利。

detailed_translations.english: a political system in which the government controls the production of all food and goods, and there is no privately owned property

name: community
trans: 社区，同一地区的全体居民

sentences.english: The new arts centre will serve the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

name: detect
trans: 查明，测出，发现，察觉；当场发现某人在干坏事

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: deter
trans: 阻挠，阻止；威慑，使不敢

sentences.english: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

name: deteriorate
trans: 使恶化，使退化

sentences.english: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.english: America’s deteriorating economy
sentences.chinese: 美国日渐恶化的经济

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

name: determine
trans: 决定，决心；确定，限定

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

name: develop
trans: 发展，开发；发育，生长

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

name: device
trans: 设备，装置；方法

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: devise
trans: 设计，发明

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

name: ensure
trans: 确保，保证，担保；保证给予

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: entail
trans: 使某事物必要，牵涉，需要，带来，引起；限定地产继承人

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

name: indeed
trans: 确实，实在

sentences.english: The blood tests prove that Vince is indeed the father.
sentences.chinese: 验血证明文斯确实是父亲。

sentences.english: ‘Would it help if you had an assistant?’ ‘It would indeed.’
sentences.chinese: “你要是有个助手，会有帮助吗？”“那是肯定的。

sentences.english: Most of the essays were very good indeed.
sentences.chinese: 这些文章大多数都非常好。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize a statement or answer

name: independence
trans: 独立，自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: independent
trans: 独立的，自主的；无党派的；私营的

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: index
trans: 索引；指标，标志；指数

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

name: mere
trans: 仅仅的，只不过；纯粹的；极小的；极不重要的

sentences.english: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 她仅仅以20票之差落选。

name: merely
trans: 仅，只，不过

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

name: plausible
trans: 貌似有理的；能说会道的，花言巧语的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

name: plea
trans: 恳求，请求；答辩，辩护；辩解，托词，借口

sentences.english: Caldwell made a plea for donations.
sentences.chinese: 考德威尔恳求捐款。

detailed_translations.english: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

name: plead
trans: 恳求，请求；答辩，辩护

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

name: plot
trans: 小块土地；情节；阴谋，秘密计划

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

name: policy
trans: 政策，方针

sentences.english: US policy towards China
sentences.chinese: 美国的对华政策

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

name: polite
trans: 有礼貌的，客气的；有教养的，文雅的

sentences.english: She’s always very polite.
sentences.chinese: 她总是很有礼貌。

sentences.english: polite, well-behaved children
sentences.chinese: 懂礼貌、守规矩的孩子

sentences.english: a clear but polite request
sentences.chinese: 明确但客气的请求

sentences.english: It’s not polite to talk with your mouth full.
sentences.chinese: 满嘴食物时讲话是不礼貌的。

detailed_translations.english: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings

name: political
trans: 政治的

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

name: politician
trans: 政治家，政客

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

name: politics
trans: 政治，政治学；政纲，政见

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

name: poll
trans: 民意测验；投票，投票结果；政治选举，大选；对...进行民意测验

sentences.english: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.english: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.chinese: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.english: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.chinese: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.english: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.chinese: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民意测验；政治选举，大选
detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
detailed_translations.english: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

name: ponder
trans: 沉思，考虑；衡量，估量；回想，回顾

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

name: brisk
trans: 兴隆的，繁忙活跃的；轻快的，生气勃勃的

sentences.english: a brisk walk
sentences.chinese: 轻快的行走

sentences.english: They set off at a brisk pace .
sentences.chinese: 他们踏着轻快的步伐上路了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻快的， 生气勃勃的； 兴隆的， 繁忙活跃的； 寒冷而清新的
detailed_translations.english: quick and full of energy

name: brief
trans: 短时间的，短暂的；简短的，简洁的

sentences.english: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。

sentences.english: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
sentences.chinese: 我们长话短说吧，我还要赶飞机。

sentences.english: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters.
sentences.chinese: 一位国防部发言人向记者们介绍了情况。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…介绍基本情况，做…的提要
detailed_translations.english: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it
a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

name: aggravate
trans: 加重，加剧，恶化

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

name: aggregate
trans: 总数，合计；总数的，总计的

sentences.english: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

name: aggressive
trans: 好斗的，侵略的；积极进取的，活跃有为的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: agitate
trans: 搅动；使激动，使狂躁

sentences.english: All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻搅动水。

detailed_translations.english: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

name: agreeable
trans: 易相处的；同意的；惬意的，令人愉快的

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

name: aid
trans: 援助，帮助；援助，救济

sentences.english: He was breathing only with the aid of a ventilator.
sentences.chinese: 他只有靠呼吸器呼吸。

sentences.english: first aid
sentences.chinese: 急救；急救护理

detailed_translations.english: help that you need to do a particular thing

name: aim
trans: 目标，目的；目的在于；瞄准，针对

sentences.english: Denver aimed his gun but did not shoot.
sentences.chinese: 丹佛举枪瞄准，但是没有射击。

sentences.english: My criticism wasn't aimed at you.
sentences.chinese: 我的批评不是针对你的。

sentences.english: They are aiming to reduce unemployment by 50%.
sentences.chinese: 他们正力求使失业人数下降50%。

detailed_translations.english: to point or direct a weapon, a shot, a kick, etc. at sb/sth

name: alarm
trans: 惊恐，忧虑；警报，警钟，报警器；使惊恐

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: alien
trans: 陌生的；外国的，异域的；外国人

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

name: alienate
trans: 排斥，疏远；使不友好；使格格不入

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

name: allocate
trans: 分配，分派，把...拨给

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

name: allow
trans: 允给，准许，允许

sentences.english: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 泳池内禁止跳水。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

name: alter
trans: 改变，更改

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

name: alternate
trans: 交替，轮流；交替的，轮流的

sentences.english: The two patterns alternate over periods of two to seven years in the tropical Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.english: To make the tiger blink, you alternate the transparency between the two areas by locating both the areas and paths in the corresponding XML.
sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

sentences.english: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数审判中，12名陪审员和2名替补人员会被选出。

detailed_translations.english: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern
two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

name: alternative
trans: 两者挑一的；可供选择的

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

name: comparable
trans: 可比较的，比得上的，类似的

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

name: comparative
trans: 比较的，相比的；相比之下的，相比而言的，相对的

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

name: compare
trans: 比较，对照；把...比作

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

name: comparison
trans: 比较，对比，比喻，比拟

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

name: compel
trans: 迫使，强迫

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

name: compensate
trans: 补偿，赔偿

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: compete
trans: 比赛，竞争

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: competition
trans: 比赛，竞争

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: competitive
trans: 比赛的，竞争的

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

name: competent
trans: 有能力的，能胜任的；不错的

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

name: compile
trans: 汇编，编制，编纂

sentences.english: The document was compiled by the Department of Health.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件是由卫生部汇编的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 编译；编制；编辑；[图情] 汇编
detailed_translations.english: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

name: complain
trans: 抱怨，诉苦；疾病

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.english: ‘You never ask my opinion about anything,’ Rod complained.
sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

sentences.english: Employees complained bitterly about working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们对工作条件十分不满。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about something or someone

name: complement
trans: 补充，补足；余数；补语

sentences.english: The team needs players who complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 球队需要能够相互取长补短的队员。

sentences.english: This wine would be a nice complement to grilled dishes.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒配烧烤食物会很不错。

detailed_translations.english: to make a good combination with someone or something else
someone or something that emphasizes the good qualities of another person or thing

name: complete
trans: 完成，结束；完全的，完整的；完成的，完结的

sentences.english: Students must complete the course.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须学完这门课程。

sentences.english: The building took two years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼花了两年时间才完工。

sentences.english: The darkness was almost complete.
sentences.chinese: 几乎是漆黑一片。

sentences.english: a complete stranger
sentences.chinese: 一个完全陌生的人

detailed_translations.english: to finish doing or making something, especially when it has taken a long time
used to emphasize that a quality or situation is as great as it could possibly be

name: complex
trans: 复杂的，费解的；合成的，综合的；综合体，集合体

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: complicate
trans: 使变复杂

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

name: complicated
trans: 错综复杂的，麻烦的

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

name: comply
trans: 遵从，顺从，服从

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

name: compliment
trans: 问候，致意；称赞，恭维

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: differ
trans: 与...不同

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

name: difference
trans: 差别，不同

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

name: diffuse
trans: 扩散；传播，散布；弥漫的，四散的；冗长的，漫无边际的

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

detailed_translations.english: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

name: emphasis
trans: 强调，重点

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

name: emphasize
trans: 强调

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: employ
trans: 雇用；用，使用

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: employee
trans: 雇主

sentences.english: a government employee
sentences.chinese: 政府雇员

detailed_translations.english: someone who is paid to work for someone else

name: employment
trans: 雇用，使用；工作，职业

sentences.english: She was offered employment in the sales office.
sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: terms and conditions of employment
sentences.chinese: 雇用条款和条件

sentences.english: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
sentences.chinese: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作； 雇用； 使用
detailed_translations.english: the condition of having a paid job

name: enable
trans: 使能够，使成为可能

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: encounter
trans: 冲突，交战；意外的遇见，遭遇

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: encourage
trans: 鼓励，支持；发展，激励，促进

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: end
trans: 端，梢；终止，结束

sentences.english: He wore spectacles perched on the very end of his nose.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼镜架在鼻尖上。

sentences.english: The end of the pencil snapped.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔的笔尖啪的一声断了。

sentences.english: Jo joined the end of the line.
sentences.chinese: 乔排到了队尾。

sentences.english: She’ll do anything to achieve her own ends.
sentences.chinese: 她为了实现自己的目标，什么都会去做。

sentences.english: The road ends here.
sentences.chinese: 这条路到此为止。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre
to finish; to make sth finish

name: endeavor
trans: 努力，尽力

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

name: endorse
trans: 赞同，支持，认可；签名，记录违章事项；宣传，代言

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

name: indicate
trans: 指出，指示；迹象，暗示

sentences.english: The study indicates a connection between poverty and crime.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示贫穷和犯罪有关联。

detailed_translations.english: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

name: indication
trans: 指出，指示；迹象，暗示

sentences.english: Could you give me some indication as to when I am likely to receive a reply?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我透露一下什么时候我能收到回复吗？

sentences.english: Indications are that the situation hasn’t improved much.
sentences.chinese: 迹象表明局势并没有多大好转。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是真的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
detailed_translations.english: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

name: indicative
trans: 指示的，暗示的

sentences.english: This behaviour is indicative of her whole attitude, I’m afraid.
sentences.chinese: 这一行为恐怕已表明了她的总体态度。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标示的，指示的，象征的；陈述的
detailed_translations.english: an indicative verb form is used for making statements
the form of a verb that is used to make statements. For example, in the sentences ‘Penny passed her test’, and ‘Michael likes cake’, the verbs ‘passed’ and ‘likes’ are in the indicative.

name: outrage
trans: 伤害，虐待，暴行；凌辱；引起...义愤

sentences.english: The response to the jury’s verdict was one of outrage.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团的裁决引发了愤慨。

sentences.english: a sense of moral outrage
sentences.chinese: 一种义愤填膺的感觉

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great anger and shock

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌辱，强奸；对…施暴行；激起愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very angry and shocked

name: outset
trans: 开始，开端

sentences.english: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。

sentences.english: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
sentences.chinese: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

detailed_translations.english: at or from the beginning of an event or process

name: outside
trans: 外部，外表；周围，外围；在外面的，向外的

sentences.english: The outside of the house was painted white.
sentences.chinese: 这房子的外墙刷成了白色。

sentences.english: Outside observers said the election was free and fair.
sentences.chinese: 外部观察员说此次选举自由而公正。

detailed_translations.english: the part or surface of something that is furthest from the centre
involving people who do not belong to the same group or organization as you

name: outward
trans: 向外，在外；向外的，外面的，外表的

sentences.english: The economy and outward appearance of the area have changed considerably.
sentences.chinese: 该地区的经济和面貌发生了很大的变化。

sentences.english: His clenched fist was the only outward sign of his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他那紧握的拳头是他内心愤怒的唯一外在表现。

sentences.english: Other poor countries looked outward, strengthening their ties to the economic superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 其他的穷国向外看，加强它们和经济大国的联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to how a person or situation seems to be, rather than how it really is

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
detailed_translations.english: If you say that a person or a group of people, such as a government, looks outward, you mean that they turn their attention to another group that they are interested in or would like greater involvement with

name: special
trans: 特殊的，专门的

sentences.english: a special place in the classroom for reading
sentences.chinese: 教室里的阅读专区

sentences.english: No one receives special treatment.
sentences.chinese: 没有人享有特殊待遇。

sentences.english: Maria’s special recipe for apple pie
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚的苹果馅饼秘方

sentences.english: The good china was used only on special occasions .
sentences.chinese: 这些精美瓷器只在特殊场合使用。

sentences.english: Each village has its own special charm.
sentences.chinese: 每一座村子都有其独特的魅力。

detailed_translations.english: not ordinary or usual, but different in some way and often better or more important

name: specialist
trans: 专家

sentences.english: a heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 心脏专科医生

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

name: specialize
trans: 专攻，专门研究；专注于；以...闻名

sentences.english: "I think the feedback can be helpful because we all have blinders on when we fall in love, " says Eva Ritvo, a Miami psychiatrist who specialize sin marriage and family therapy.
sentences.chinese: 专门从事婚姻与家庭疗法研究的迈阿密精神病专家瑞塔沃说：“我认为信息回馈是有用的，因为人们在恋爱时都会变得盲目。

sentences.english: The research work is being done by a small group of dedicated and imaginative scientists who specialize in extracting from various sea animals substances that may improve the health of the human race.
sentences.chinese: 一小部分富有想像力和敬业精神的科学家正在进行这项研究，他们专门研究从各种海洋动物中提取能增进人类健康的物质。

detailed_translations.english: to limit all or most of your study, business etc to a particular subject or activity

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应特殊目的， 使专用于

name: speciality
trans: 特制品，特产；专业，专长

sentences.english: the region’s speciality cheese
sentences.chinese: 该地区的特色干酪

sentences.english: His speciality is international law.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是国际法。

detailed_translations.chinese: (specialty) 特色食品; 特产；专业；专门研究；专长
detailed_translations.english: Someone's speciality is a particular type of work that they do most or do best, or a subject that they know a lot about

name: species
trans: 种，种类

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: specific
trans: 明确的，具体的；特定的，特有的

sentences.english: games suitable for specific age groups
sentences.chinese: 适合特定年龄组的游戏

sentences.english: a specific example of alcohol’s effect on the body
sentences.chinese: 酒精对身体影响的具体例子

detailed_translations.english: a specific thing, person, or group is one particular thing, person, or group
particular details

name: specification
trans: 详述，明确；规格，说明书，规范

sentences.english: The bolts met all the engineering specifications.
sentences.chinese: 这些螺栓符合所有的工程设计规格。

sentences.english: a specification of what role each member will play
sentences.chinese: 每名成员担当什么角色的具体说明

detailed_translations.english: a detailed instruction about how a car, building, piece of equipment etc should be made

name: specify
trans: 具体指定，详细说明

sentences.english: Payments will be made for a specified number of months.
sentences.chinese: 款项将在规定的几个月内支付。

sentences.english: They specified a spacious entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 他们明确要求门厅要宽敞。

detailed_translations.english: to state something in an exact and detailed way

name: speculate
trans: 推测，推断；投机

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: acclaim
trans: 喝彩，欢呼；称誉，高度评价

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: accommodate
trans: 使适应，使符合一致；向...提供住宿；容纳，接纳

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: accommodation
trans: 住宿，留宿

sentences.english: The price for the holiday includes flights and accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 度假的价格包括机票和住宿。

sentences.english: living accommodations for the crews
sentences.chinese: 船员的起居舱

sentences.english: travel and hotel accommodations
sentences.chinese: 旅行及酒店住宿

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["rented accommodation"]}
sentences.chinese: 租用的住处

sentences.english: secure accommodation for young offenders
sentences.chinese: 严密看管的少年犯囚室

sentences.english: Universities have to provide student accommodation for first-year students.
sentences.chinese: 大学必须为一年级生提供学生宿舍。

detailed_translations.english: a place for someone to stay, live, or work

name: accompany
trans: 陪伴，伴随；为...伴奏

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: accomplish
trans: 达到目的，完成任务；做到，做成

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: account
trans: 账目，账户；认为，视为

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: accountant
trans: 会计

sentences.english: The boss dropped an accountant from the payroll.
sentences.chinese: 老板把一名会计师从在职人员名单中除了名。

sentences.english: The accountant checked this unnecessary spending in good time.
sentences.chinese: 会计及时卡住了这笔不必要的开支。

sentences.english: They conferred with the accountant vis-à-vis the proposed budget.
sentences.chinese: 他们与会计商量有关预算提案的事。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to keep and check financial accounts, calculate taxes etc

name: bias
trans: 偏见；使有偏见

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

name: bid
trans: 祝愿；命令，吩咐；出价，投标

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: bill
trans: 账单；招贴，广告；法案；单子，清单；钞票

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: billion
trans: 十亿

sentences.english: The final cost could be as much as one billion dollars.
sentences.chinese: 最后的费用可能高达十亿美元。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1,000,000,000

name: birth
trans: 出生，分娩；出身，血统

sentences.english: Congratulations on the birth of your daughter!
sentences.chinese: 恭喜你生了个女儿！

sentences.english: He only weighed 2 kilos at birth.
sentences.chinese: 他出生时体重只有两公斤。

sentences.english: Henry has been blind from birth.
sentences.chinese: 亨利先天失明。

sentences.english: What’s your date of birth ?
sentences.chinese: 你的出生日期是哪一天？

sentences.english: The exact place of birth is not recorded.
sentences.chinese: 确切的出生地没有记录。

sentences.english: They believe that the position of the planets at the time of birth determines the fate of the individual.
sentences.chinese: 他们相信，出生时的星象决定了一个人的命运。

sentences.english: More and more women are choosing to have home births.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性选择在家分娩。

sentences.english: Smoking in pregnancy has been linked to premature birth.
sentences.chinese: 孕期吸烟已被认为与早产有关联。

sentences.english: the association between birth weight and blood pressure
sentences.chinese: 出生体重和血压的关系

sentences.english: The drug was found to cause serious birth defects.
sentences.chinese: 这种药被发现可造成严重的先天缺陷。

sentences.english: a woman of noble birth
sentences.chinese: 一位出身于贵族的女子

detailed_translations.english: the time when a baby comes out of its mother’s body

name: charge
trans: 控告，指控；充电；负荷，电荷；价钱，费用

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

detailed_translations.english: electricity that is put into a piece of electrical equipment such as a battery
to fill a glass

name: charm
trans: 魅力，魔力；美貌，妩媚

sentences.english: Joe’s boyish charm
sentences.chinese: 乔身上的稚趣

sentences.english: She turned on the charm (= used her charm ) to all the men.
sentences.chinese: 她对所有那些男人都施展魅力。

sentences.english: The room had no windows and all the charm of a prison cell (= used to say that something has no charm ) .
sentences.chinese: 这房间没有窗，简直就是牢房。

detailed_translations.english: a special quality someone or something has that makes people like them, feel attracted to them, or be easily influenced by them – used to show approval

name: chase
trans: 追逐，追求；追逐，追求

sentences.english: The dogs saw him running and chased him.
sentences.chinese: 那些狗看到他在跑就追他。

sentences.english: kids chasing around the house
sentences.chinese: 在屋里追逐嬉戏的孩子们

detailed_translations.chinese: 追逐， 追赶， 追求
detailed_translations.english: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them

name: demand
trans: 要求，请求

sentences.english: Angry demonstrators demanded the resignation of two senior officials.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

sentences.english: ‘Where are you going?’ she demanded angrily.
sentences.chinese: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this
the need or desire that people have for particular goods and services

name: democracy
trans: 民主，民主制；民主国家

sentences.english: a return to democracy after 16 years of military rule
sentences.chinese: 16年军人统治后民主制度的恢复

detailed_translations.english: a system of government in which every citizen in the country can vote to elect its government officials

name: democratic
trans: 民主的

sentences.english: a democratic government
sentences.chinese: 民主政府

sentences.english: the role of the media in the democratic process
sentences.chinese: 民主进程中媒体的作用

detailed_translations.english: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country

name: demographic
trans: 人口统计学的，人口统计的

sentences.english: In the same demographic breakdown of people may have different characteristics of the consumer mentality.
sentences.chinese: 处于同一人口统计细分的人们，可能具有不同的消费心态特征。

sentences.english: It is generally studied and mapped by an organization through lists and reportscontaining demographic information that may have an effect on the marketing of keyproducts or services.
sentences.chinese: 组织通常通过包含了可能对主要产品或服务的市场营销产生影响的人口统计信息的列表或包括来研究或划分它的。

name: demonstrate
trans: 论证，证明；示范，宣传；游行，示威

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

name: denote
trans: 表示；是...的标志；意思是

sentences.english: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
sentences.chinese: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

detailed_translations.english: to mean something

name: denial
trans: 否认；拒绝，拒绝给予

sentences.english: The government issued an official denial of the rumour.
sentences.chinese: 政府发表了正式声明，否认谣言。

sentences.english: His girlfriend is in denial, and refuses to admit that he will soon die.
sentences.chinese: 他的女友不肯接受事实，拒不相信他很快就要死了。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that something is not true

name: deny
trans: 否定，否认

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

name: department
trans: 部，局，处；系，学部

sentences.english: the personnel department
sentences.chinese: 人事部

sentences.english: the English department
sentences.chinese: 英语系

detailed_translations.english: one of the groups of people who work together in a particular part of a large organization such as a hospital, university, company, or government

name: depend
trans: 取决于，依靠

sentences.english: He depended on his writing for his income.
sentences.chinese: 他靠写作谋生。

sentences.english: You can depend on Jane – she always keeps her promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信简——她一向都信守诺言。

detailed_translations.english: to need the support, help, or existence of someone or something in order to exist, be healthy, be successful etc

name: dependent
trans: 依靠的，依赖的；取决于...的

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: deposit
trans: 使沉积；存放；存款

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

name: depress
trans: 使沮丧；使不景气；按下

sentences.english: The thought of taking the exam again depressed him.
sentences.chinese: 想到要补考，他就心情沮丧。

sentences.english: It depresses me that nobody seems to care.
sentences.chinese: 似乎没有人在乎，这让我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Depress the clutch fully.
sentences.chinese: 把离合器踩到底。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very unhappy

name: emerge
trans: 出现，浮现

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: emergence
trans: 出现

sentences.english: The day after that, the emergence of a new competitor.
sentences.chinese: 今后的每一天都可能出现新的竞争对手。

sentences.english: Language emerges and develops with the emergence and development of society.
sentences.chinese: 语言是随着社会的产生而产生，随着社会的发展而发展的。

sentences.english: They prefer to wait for the emergence of a new physics theory of everything.
sentences.chinese: 他们更倾向于等待新的可以解释一切的理论的出现.

detailed_translations.english: when something begins to be known or noticed

name: emergency
trans: 紧急情况，突然事件，非常时刻

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

name: eminent
trans: 杰出的，著名的；明显的，突出的

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: emotion
trans: 情绪，情感

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

name: fear
trans: 害怕，畏惧；害怕，担心

sentences.english: a fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 害怕坐飞机

sentences.english: Fearing violence, the group asked for police protection.
sentences.chinese: 该团体担心发生暴力事件，所以请求警方保护。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you get when you are afraid or worried that something bad is going to happen
to feel afraid or worried that something bad may happen

name: fearful
trans: 担心的；可怕的

sentences.english: a shy and fearful child
sentences.chinese: 一个羞涩、胆怯的小孩

detailed_translations.english: frightened that something bad might happen

name: feature
trans: 特征，特色；特写

sentences.english: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.english: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.english: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.english: It's a great film and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year.
sentences.chinese: 那是一部精彩的电影，它由一位西班牙演员主演，他一年之内就会成为国际明星。

sentences.english: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games.
sentences.chinese: 这个一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍近期比赛的精彩部分。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片
detailed_translations.english: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

name: federal
trans: 联邦的

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。
